Quiz Results

Part 67 of 85 (Quiz Attempts 661-670)

Quiz Attempt #119616

Total Questions: 17
Question 1
Which of the following is/are a type(s) of direct marketing? (UGC NET Management Dec 2013)
  • A.Direct-Response Advertising
  • B.Personal Selling
  • C.Telemarketing
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

Direct marketing refers to the practice of communicating directly with consumers to promote products, services, or causes. It involves reaching out to potential customers through various communication channels without intermediaries.

 

(i) Direct-Response Advertising: This is a form of direct marketing where advertisers create compelling messages that prompt consumers to take immediate action, such as making a purchase, calling a toll-free number, visiting a website, or requesting more information. Direct-response advertising includes methods like infomercials, print ads with response mechanisms (such as coupons or QR codes), online ads with "click here" buttons, and more. The goal is to elicit a direct and measurable response from the audience.

 

(ii) Personal Selling: Personal selling is a face-to-face communication and persuasion process that involves direct interaction between a salesperson and a potential customer. It is a form of direct marketing because it allows for personalized and tailored communication, where the salesperson can address the specific needs and concerns of the customer. This type of interaction aims to build relationships and guide the customer through the purchasing decision.

 

(iii) Telemarketing: Telemarketing involves using telephone calls to directly communicate with potential customers. Telemarketers engage in conversations with prospects to introduce products or services, answer questions, and encourage purchases. While telemarketing has evolved to include outbound and inbound calls, the core principle remains direct communication between the company and the consumer.

 

Given that all three options—Direct-Response Advertising, Personal Selling, and Telemarketing—are distinct forms of direct marketing, the correct answer is (D) All of the above. Each of these methods allows businesses to directly engage with consumers to promote their offerings, gather feedback, and facilitate sales transactions without relying on intermediaries.

Question 2
Which of the following is direct marketing? (UGC NET Management Dec 2013)
  • A.Face to-face marketing
  • B.Catalogue marketing
  • C.Direct mailing
  • D.Test marketing
Correct Answer: Face to-face marketing

Among the options, face-to-face marketing (Option A) best represents direct marketing by allowing direct interaction and personalized communication between a salesperson and a potential customer. Face-to-face marketing involves direct interaction between a salesperson and a potential customer. It allows for personalized conversations, demonstrations, and immediate responses to queries. This direct engagement builds a personal connection and influences purchasing decisions.

 

Catalogue marketing: Catalogue marketing entails sending printed or digital catalogues showcasing products to potential customers. While direct, it lacks personal interaction, making it less immediate than other direct marketing methods.

 

Direct mailing: Direct mailing involves sending promotional materials like brochures and flyers directly to a recipient's mailbox. While a form of direct communication, it does not involve face-to-face interaction.

 

Test marketing: Test marketing is about launching a product in a specific market to gather feedback before a full launch. It's a marketing strategy but doesn't involve direct engagement with customers.

Question 3
Statement – I: Direct marketing is a non-interactive marketing system. (UGC NET Management Jan 2017)Statement – II: Direct marketing uses one or more media to affect a measurable response or transaction at any location.Select the correct code:Codes:
  • A.Both the Statements are correct.
  • B.Both the Statements are incorrect.
  • C.Only Statement – I is correct.
  • D.Only Statement – II is correct.
Correct Answer: Only Statement – II is correct.

As Statement II is correct while Statement, I is incorrect, the correct answer is (D) Only Statement – II is correct.

 

Statement I suggest that direct marketing is a non-interactive marketing system. This statement is incorrect. Direct marketing, in fact, involves direct communication and interaction between the company and the individual customers or target audience. It is a form of marketing where companies communicate with potential customers directly through various channels such as email, direct mail, social media, telemarketing, and more. Direct marketing encourages two-way communication and engagement to promote products or services, gather feedback, and build customer relationships.

 

Statement II accurately describes the concept of direct marketing. It emphasizes that direct marketing employs one or more media (communication channels) to prompt a measurable response or transaction from potential customers. This response could be in the form of making a purchase, filling out a form, signing up for a newsletter, or taking any other specific action that can be tracked and measured. Direct marketing allows companies to target specific individuals or segments with personalized messages and incentives, aiming to achieve a direct and measurable impact.

Question 4
Direct marketing is carried out in variety of ways, some of the main forms of direct marketing are (UGC NET Management Dec 2019)(a) Mail order marketing(b) Telemarketing(c) Online marketing(d) Direct sellingWhich of the following option is correct?
  • A.(a), (b) and (c) only
  • B.(a), (b), (c) and (d)
  • C.(a), (b) and (d) only
  • D.(a) and (c) only
Correct Answer: (a), (b) and (c) only

The correct option is (A) (a), (b), and (c) only

 

Direct marketing encompasses various methods of reaching and engaging with potential customers without intermediaries. Here is an explanation of the provided options:

 

(a) Mail order marketing: This involves marketing products through catalogs or mailings directly to customers, who can place orders through mail or phone.

 

(b) Telemarketing: Telemarketing is the practice of marketing products or services by making phone calls to potential customers. It's a form of direct marketing where sales representatives reach out to prospects over the phone.

 

(c) Online marketing: Online marketing involves using the internet to promote products or services directly to consumers. This includes various methods such as email marketing, social media advertising, pay-per-click advertising, and more.

 

So, the correct option is (A), which includes mail order marketing, telemarketing, and online marketing as main forms of direct marketing.

Question 5
Which of the following statements are true for Direct Marketing? (UGC NET Commerce Dec 2022)A. Direct marketing is an interactive mode of marketing.B. Direct marketing model is based on Network marketing and multi-cultural marketing.C. Globalisation of markets and the internet have facilitated the growth of direct marketing.D. Future of direct marketing in India is independent of use of debit and credit cards.E. Direct marketing activities are not location specific.Choose the correct answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.A and B only
  • B.B, C and D only
  • C.A, C and E only
  • D.A, C, D and E only
Correct Answer: A, C and E only

The correct answer is (C) A, C, and E only.

 

A. Direct marketing is an interactive mode of marketing: This statement is true. Direct marketing involves direct communication between the marketer and the target audience. It often includes methods like email marketing, telemarketing, direct mail, and personalized advertising. These channels allow for two-way communication between the marketer and the potential customer, making it an interactive form of marketing.

 

C. Globalization of markets and the internet have facilitated the growth of direct marketing: This statement is also true. With the globalization of markets and the widespread availability of the internet, businesses can reach customers across the globe more easily than ever before. Direct marketing benefits from these developments because it enables companies to target specific customer segments directly, whether they are in the local market or in distant locations.

 

E. Direct marketing activities are not location-specific: This statement is true. Direct marketing methods, such as email campaigns, online advertising, and direct mail, are not tied to a specific physical location. Marketers can reach their target audience regardless of their geographic location. This lack of location specificity is one of the advantages of direct marketing, as it allows for broader market reach.

Question 6
Which one of the following modes is not an example of Direct and Database marketing communication? (UGC NET Commerce Dec 2018)
  • A.Mailings
  • B.Catalogues
  • C.Telemarketing
  • D.Social media marketing
Correct Answer: Social media marketing

The correct answer is (D) Social media marketing.

 

Social media marketing, while it involves reaching out to customers and potential customers through various social media platforms, is not typically categorized as a direct and database marketing communication mode. Direct and database marketing communication methods usually involve targeted, personalized communication directly to individual customers or prospects, often based on their specific preferences, demographics, or purchase history. Social media marketing, on the other hand, tends to reach a broader audience and may not always be as personalized or targeted as direct and database marketing methods like mailings, catalogues, and telemarketing.

Question 7
Which of the following is not a major direct selling company in India? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)
  • A.Eureka Forbes
  • B.Amway India Enterprises
  • C.Modicare
  • D.Hindustan Unilever Ltd.
Correct Answer: Hindustan Unilever Ltd.

The correct answer is (D) Hindustan Unilever Ltd.

 

Hindustan Unilever Ltd. is not a major direct selling company in India. It is a well-known consumer goods company that operates primarily through traditional retail channels rather than direct selling. On the other hand, Eureka Forbes, Amway India Enterprises, and Modicare are well-known direct selling companies in India. They use a direct selling model to distribute their products directly to consumers through a network of distributors or representatives.

Question 8
Tele-marketing is a part of (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)
  • A.Viral marketing
  • B.Social marketing
  • C.Direct marketing
  • D.Relationship marketing
Correct Answer: Direct marketing

The correct answer is (C) Direct marketing.

 

Tele-marketing is a form of direct marketing that involves reaching out to potential customers and promoting products or services via telephone calls. In direct marketing, businesses communicate directly with the target audience to promote their offerings, generate sales, or gather information. Tele-marketing is one of the methods used in direct marketing to engage with customers, answer their queries, and persuade them to make purchases or take specific actions related to the marketed products or services.

Question 9
Which of the following is/are type(s) of Direct Marketing?
  • A.Direct-Response Advertising
  • B.Personal Selling
  • C.Telemarketing
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

Direct Response Advertising- Promotional method in which a prospective customer is urged to respond immediately and directly to the advertiser, through the use of a 'device' provided in the advertisement. These devices (called direct response mechanisms) include a (1) coupon to cut and mail, (2) business reply card, (3) toll-free telephone number, or, on the internet, (4) hotspot to click. Most retail sale advertisements are direct response ads in one way or the other.

 

Personal Selling – As the name implies, this form of promotion involves personal contact between company representatives and those who have a role in purchase decisions (e.g., make the decision, such as consumers, or have an influence on a decision, such as members of a company buying center). Often this occurs face-to-face or via telephone, though newer technologies allow this to occur online via video conferencing or text chat

 

Telemarketing – involves the use of the telephone and call centers to attract prospects, sell to existing customers, and provide service by taking orders and answering questions. Types of Telemarketing are:

1.Telesales (taking order)

2.Telecoverage (calling customers)

3.Teleprospecting (generating new leads)

4.customer service and technical support

Question 10
__________ is the use of Consumer-Direct (CD) channels to reach and deliver goods and services to customers without using marketing middlemen:
  • A.Customer-centric Marketing
  • B.Interactive Marketing
  • C.Direct Marketing
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Direct Marketing

Direct marketing is the use of consumer-direct (CD) channels to reach and deliver goods and services to customers without using marketing middlemen. Direct marketers can use a number of channels to reach individual prospects and customers: direct mail, catalog marketing, telemarketing, interactive TV, kiosks, Web sites, and mobile devices. They often seek direct order marketing which seeks a measurable response, typically a customer order.

 

Direct marketing has been a fast-growing avenue for serving customers, partly in response to the high and increasing costs of reaching business markets through a sales force.

Direct mail marketing: Marketing that occurs by sending an offer, announcement, reminder, or other item directly to a person at a particular address.

Catalog Marketing: Direct marketing through print, video, or digital catalogs that are mailed to select customers, made available in stores, or presenting online.

Direct Response Television Marketing: Direct marketing via television, including direct-response television advertising (or infomercials) and interactive television (iTV) advertising.

Telemarketing: Using the telephone to sell directly to customers.

Question 11
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Market demassification has resulted in an ever-increasing number of market niches.Statement II:Consumers short of time and tired of traffic and parking headaches appreciate direct marketers’ commitment to customer service.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

The Benefits of Direct Marketing:

Market demassification (fragmenting homogeneous social collectively) has resulted in an ever-increasing number of market niches. Consumers short of time and tired of traffic and parking headaches appreciate toll-free phone numbers, always-open Web sites, next-day delivery, and direct marketers’ commitment to customer service.

 

Sellers benefit from demassification as well. Direct marketers can buy a mailing list containing the names of almost any group: left-handed people, overweight people, millionaires. They can customize and personalize messages and build a continuous relationship with each customer. For example, new parents will receive periodic mailings describing new clothes, toys, and other goods as their child grows.

 

Direct marketing can reach prospects at the moment they want a solicitation and therefore be noticed by more highly interested prospects. It lets marketers test alternative media and messages to find the most cost-effective approach.

Question 12
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Direct-mail marketing means sending an offer, announcement, reminder, or other item to an individual consumer.Statement II:Only issue with Direct Mail is that it does not permit target market selectivity.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect

Direct-mail marketing means sending an offer, announcement, reminder, or other item to an individual consumer. Using highly selective mailing lists, direct marketers send out millions of mail pieces each year such as letters, flyers, foldouts.

 

Direct mail is a popular medium because it permits target market selectivity, can be personalized, is flexible, and allows early testing and response measurement. Although the cost is higher than for mass media, the people reached are much better prospects. The success of direct mail, however, has also become its liability—so many marketers are sending out direct-mail pieces that mailboxes are becoming stuffed, leading some consumers to disregard the blizzard of solicitations they receive.

 

In constructing an effective direct-mail campaign, direct marketers must choose their objectives, target markets and prospects, offer elements, means of testing the campaign, and measures of campaign success.

Question 13
Which of the following is NOT an element of offer strategy?
  • A.Sales Letter
  • B.Product
  • C.Creative Strategy
  • D.Medium
Correct Answer: Sales Letter

The offer strategy has 5 elements: the product, the offer, the medium, the distribution method, and the creative strategy which all can be tested.

 

The direct-mail marketer also must choose 5 components of the mailing itself: the outside envelope, sales letter, circular, reply form, and reply envelope. A common direct marketing strategy is to follow up direct mail with an e-mail.

Question 14
____________ is the use of the telephone and call centres to attract prospects, sell to existing customers, and provide service by taking orders and answering questions
  • A.Customer Care
  • B.Telemarketing
  • C.Telecalling
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Telemarketing

Telemarketing is the use of the telephone and call centers to attract prospects, sell to existing customers, and provide service by taking orders and answering questions. It helps companies increase revenue, reduce selling costs, and improve customer satisfaction.

 

Companies use call centers for inbound telemarketing—receiving calls from customers—and outbound telemarketing—initiating calls to prospects and customers.

Question 15
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Direct marketers and their customers usually enjoy mutually rewarding relationships.Statement II:Most direct marketers want the same thing consumers want: honest and well-designed marketing offers targeted only to those who appreciate hearing about them.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

Direct marketers and their customers usually enjoy mutually rewarding relationships. Occasionally, however, a darker side emerges:

 

(a) Irritation: Many people don’t like hard-sell, direct marketing solicitations.

(b) Unfairness: Some direct marketers take advantage of impulsive or less sophisticated buyers or prey on the vulnerable, especially the elderly.

(c) Deception and fraud: Some direct marketers design mailers and write copy intended to mislead or exaggerate product size, performance claims, or the “retail price.” Regulatory Agency receives thousands of complaints each year about fraudulent investment scams and phony charities.

(d) Invasion of privacy: It seems that almost every time consumers order products by mail or telephone, apply for a credit card, or take out a magazine subscription, their names, addresses, and purchasing behavior may be added to several company databases. Critics worry that marketers may know too much about consumers’ lives, and that they may use this knowledge to take unfair advantage.

 

People in the direct marketing industry know that, if left unattended, such problems will lead to increasingly negative consumer attitudes, lower response rates, and calls for greater state and central regulation. Most direct marketers want the same thing consumers want: honest and well-designed marketing offers targeted only to those who appreciate hearing about them.

Question 16
Which of the following is NOT a type of direct marketing? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2015)
  • A.Direct mail marketing
  • B.Retail marketing
  • C.Telemarketing
  • D.Direct email marketing
Correct Answer: Retail marketing

Telemarketing: The products are advertised on the television. The price, warranty, return policies, buying schemes, contact number etc. are described at the end of the Ad. The consumers can place order by calling the retailer’s number. The retailer then delivers the product at the consumer’s doorstep. For example, Asian Skyshop.

 

Direct mail marketing is a type of direct marketing in which businesses send letters, postcards, or other promotional materials to past, current or potential customers, or clients. Direct mail campaigns may be targeted to either a consumer or business or both.

 

Direct email marketing is a format for email-based campaigns in which standalone advertisements are sent to a targeted list of recipients. The messages, which may be text, HTML, or rich media, look like Web-based ads rather than typical email messages.

 

Direct marketing: Connecting directly with carefully targeted segments or individual consumers, often on a one-to-one, interactive basis. This is opposite of retail marketing hence, not included in one of the methods.

Question 17
The major advantage of the Direct Mail Marketing is:
  • A.High target-market selectivity
  • B.Low cost of transaction
  • C.Privacy of the buyer
  • D.Speedy delivery
Correct Answer: High target-market selectivity

As many companies search for new ways to reach customers and prospects, traditional marketing approaches like direct mail campaigns are often replaced with online advertisements and other technology-based techniques. But direct mail still offers one of the most consistently effective forms of advertising. Creating a direct mail campaign is an easy and cost-effective way to maximize your advertising efforts.

 

1. Direct mailing is highly targeted. Each direct mail campaign can be tailored for a specific audience, from long-time customers to new prospects. Thus, customers receive only offers or information that meet their individual needs or buying habits. Direct mail can be personalized. In addition to targeting customers with relevant campaigns, direct mail pieces can be customized to include names and other personal information. This personalized touch means that customers are more likely to heed your message and follow through with a purchase.

 

2. Mail is tangible. Because direct mail is essentially delivered directly to customers’ and prospects’ hands, they are virtually guaranteed to see and read your message. Since customers can also physically touch a piece of mail, they are more likely to see its contents as reliable.

 

3. The format is familiar. Postal service is one of the oldest public-service institutions in most developed countries. While many customers may be skeptical about email messages or other novel marketing media, they remain more receptive to direct mail, to which they are accustomed. The wide variety of formats and options, from postcards and brochures, to magazines and catalogs, makes direct mailing a suitable strategy for almost any application.

 

4. The results of direct mail can be measured without complicated analytics. To track the success of a direct mail campaign, one need only count the number of inquiries made or coupons redeemed from a given mail piece. Creating and executing a direct mail campaign is easy.

 

5. Direct mail is cost effective. While the creation itself is easy and affordable, actually mailing each campaign is also relatively economical. Mass mail rates are available for any form of direct mail campaign.

 

6. Direct mail has a proven track record. Because this technique has been so widely used for a long time, much data exists to demonstrate its effectiveness. Direct mail campaigns offer reliable returns with negligible cost.

Quiz Attempt #119617

Total Questions: 55
Question 1
_______ is a marketing term for any design to prompt an immediate response or encourage an immediate sale.(UGC NET Commerce Dec 2023)
  • A.Call for Promotion
  • B.Call for Activity
  • C.Call to Action
  • D.Call to Aspiration
Correct Answer: Call to Action

A "Call to Action" (CTA) is a marketing term that refers to any element within a marketing message designed to prompt an immediate response or encourage an immediate sale. It typically appears as a clear and concise directive, urging the audience to take a specific action, such as "Buy Now," "Sign Up Today," or "Learn More." CTAs are strategically placed within advertisements, emails, websites, and other marketing materials to guide potential customers towards the desired action, ultimately driving conversions and engagement. By leveraging compelling CTAs, marketers aim to capture the audience's attention, generate interest, and motivate them to take the next step in the customer journey.

Question 2
Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of digital media?(UGC NET Management Jun 2023)
  • A.Digital media is "pull" media
  • B.Mass customization is possible in digital media
  • C.Digital media is lean-back media
  • D.Digital media is intense media
Correct Answer: Digital media is lean-back media

Correct answer is option C – Digital media is lean-back media.

 

Digital media is "pull" media:

This statement is correct. Digital media is often referred to as "pull" media because users have the control to access content whenever they want, pulling it towards themselves. This is in contrast to traditional "push" media, where content is pushed to users on a predetermined schedule.

 

Mass customization is possible in digital media:

This statement is also correct. Digital media allows for personalized and targeted content delivery, making mass customization feasible. Advertisers and content creators can tailor their messages and offerings to specific audiences based on their preferences and behaviours.

 

Digital media is lean-back media:

This statement is incorrect. Digital media is often considered "lean-forward" media rather than "lean-back" media. "Lean-back" media refers to passive consumption where users relax and consume content without much interaction. In contrast, digital media often requires user engagement, interaction, and participation, making it more of a "lean-forward" experience.

Question 3
Which one of the following is not a social network of social media platforms?(UGC NET Commerce Dec 2024)
  • A.Facebook
  • B.Blogs
  • C.Twitter
  • D.YouTube
Correct Answer: Blogs

Blogs are content-sharing platforms rather than social networking platforms. Social networks like Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube focus on user interactions, connections, and content sharing, whereas blogs primarily serve as personal or professional publishing platforms without a direct social networking structure.

Question 4
Which of the following Digital marketing statements are correct? (UGC NET Management Dec 2022)a. Click through Rate is calculated by dividing the total number of clicks by the total number of ad impressions.b. Long tail keywords are general key words which draw lower customer traffic.c. AdWords is Google’s earned search marketing programme.d. Search Engine Marketing includes both search engine optimization and paid search.e. Ad Auction is the process that Google runs for every Google search to decide which ad must appear for that specific search and in which order these set of ads will be displayed.Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.a, b and c only
  • B.b, c and d only
  • C.a, b and e only
  • D.a, d and e only
Correct Answer: a, d and e only

The correct statements are a, d and e.

 

Click-through rate (CTR) is calculated by dividing the total number of clicks on an ad by the total number of impressions it receives, expressed as a percentage. It measures the effectiveness of an online advertising campaign in terms of how many people clicked on the ad after seeing it.

 

Long-tail keywords are more specific, longer phrases that are less frequently searched for but tend to draw more targeted traffic to a website. They may have lower search volumes, but they often have higher conversion rates because they are more relevant to the user's intent.

 

AdWords is Google's pay-per-click (PPC) advertising platform that allows businesses to bid on keywords to display their ads on Google's search engine results pages (SERPs) and other partner sites.

 

Search engine marketing (SEM) includes both search engine optimization (SEO) and paid search advertising. SEO is the process of optimizing a website to rank higher in organic search results, while paid search involves placing ads in search engine results for specific keywords.

 

Ad auction is the process that Google uses to determine which ads to show and in what order on its search engine results pages. It considers factors like the ad's bid, relevance, and expected impact on the user experience to determine the ad's Ad Rank and placement.

Question 5
Two Men are on WhatsApp discussing a holiday plan. Immediately, Uber pops up within WhatsApp to help book a ride and provide an estimate. This is known as [UGC NETManagement June 2019]
  • A.Contextual digital marketing
  • B.Direct mail marketing
  • C.Mail order marketing
  • D.Telemarketing
Correct Answer: Contextual digital marketing

Contextual marketing is an online marketing model in which people are served with targeted advertising based on terms they search for or their recent browsing behavior. By tying the ads users see to their demonstrated interests, advertisers hope to decrease user annoyance with online marketing and, simultaneously, increase clickthrough and conversion rates. 

 

Direct mail is a type of direct marketing in which businesses send letters, postcards, or other promotional materials to past, current, or potential customers, or clients.

 

Mail order marketing is a method of merchandising in which the seller's offer is made through mass mailing of a circular or catalogue or through an advertisement placed in a newspaper or magazine and in which the buyer places an order by mail.

 

Telemarketing is a method of direct marketing in which a salesperson solicits prospective customers to buy products or services, either over the phone.

Question 6
The following statements relate to social media. Choose the correct code for the statements being correct or incorrect. (UGC NET Management Dec 2018)Statement I: Social media does not allow users to interact among themselves.Statement II:Social media helps facilitate the consumers decision process by encouraging need recognition, information search, alternative evaluation, purchase and post purchase reviews.Codes:
  • A.Statement I is correct, but Il is incorrect.
  • B.Both the statements I and II are incorrect.
  • C.Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect.
  • D.Both the statements I and II are correct.
Correct Answer: Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect.

The given question addresses statements related to social media and requires you to determine their correctness. Let us evaluate each statement:

 

Statement I: "Social media does not allow users to interact among themselves."

This statement is incorrect. Social media platforms are specifically designed to enable users to interact with each other. Interactions can include commenting, liking, sharing, messaging, and participating in discussions, all of which facilitate engagement and communication among users.

 

Statement II: "Social media helps facilitate the consumers decision process by encouraging need recognition, information search, alternative evaluation, purchase, and post-purchase reviews."

This statement is correct. Social media indeed plays a significant role in various stages of the consumer decision-making process. It can trigger need recognition through exposure to products or services, provide information through user-generated content, reviews, and brand content, aid in alternative evaluation by presenting different options, and even influence the purchase decision. Additionally, consumers often share their post-purchase experiences and reviews on social media, which can further impact others' decisions.

 

The correct answer is (C) "Statement II is correct, but I is incorrect." This means that while Statement II is accurate in describing the role of social media in the consumer decision process, Statement I is incorrect as social media platforms do allow users to interact with each other.

Question 7
E-commerce and large retailers in India bet big on mega consumption events on which of the following days? (UGC NET Commerce Dec 2022)A. Republic DayB. Independence DayC. Black FridayD. Cyber MondayE. Akshya TritiyaChoose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:Codes
  • A.A and B only
  • B.C and D only
  • C.A, B and E only
  • D.A, B, C, D and E
Correct Answer: A, B, C, D and E

E-commerce and large retailers in India bet big on mega consumption events on several days throughout the year, including Republic Day, Independence Day, Black Friday, Cyber Monday, and Akshaya Tritiya.

 

Republic Day and Independence Day are two of the most significant national holidays in India, and retailers often offer sales and discounts to attract customers. Black Friday and Cyber Monday, which originated in the United States but have since gained popularity worldwide, are also widely observed by Indian e-commerce companies and retailers, who offer deep discounts on a range of products.

 

Akshaya Tritiya, a Hindu festival that falls in the month of April or May, is also a popular day for shopping, particularly for gold and other precious items, as it is believed to bring good luck and prosperity.

Question 8
In e-commerce, one of the key design elements of an affective website-community refers to (UGC NET Commerce Dec 2019)
  • A.Its layout and design
  • B.The way site enables user to user communication
  • C.Site’s ability to tailor itself to different users or to allow users to personalize the site
  • D.Degree that the site is linked to the other sites
Correct Answer: The way site enables user to user communication

The correct answer is (B) The way the site enables user-to-user communication.

 

In the context of an effective website-community in e-commerce, the key design element refers to the way the website facilitates communication among users. An effective e-commerce website community encourages and enables interaction, engagement, and communication among users. This interaction can take various forms, such as forums, comments, reviews, discussions, messaging systems, etc. Allowing users to communicate with each other enhances the overall user experience and fosters a sense of community within the website, ultimately leading to increased engagement and customer satisfaction.

Question 9
Which of the following is NOT true web marketers? (UGC NET Commerce Dec 2019)
  • A.Web marketers usually try to attract prospects to their site through email, advertisements in newspapers
  • B.Use attractions like discounts, gifts and contests
  • C.Ask customers to give their personal data mandatorily
  • D.Give a lot of publicity to the discount schemes
Correct Answer: Ask customers to give their personal data mandatorily

The correct answer is (C) Ask customers to give their personal data mandatorily.

 

Web marketers do collect customer data for various purposes, including personalization, targeted advertising, and improving user experience. However, it is not considered a best practice to mandate or force customers to provide their personal data. In most cases, web marketers aim to obtain customer data through voluntary means, such as offering incentives, ensuring transparency in data collection and usage policies, and respecting privacy preferences. Mandating personal data collection without the customer's consent may lead to privacy concerns and potential legal issues. Therefore, option (C) is not true for web marketers.

Question 10
Match List I with List II (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)List I (Authors)I.  Bill BishopII. D. BirdIII. Daniel S. JonalIV. Jeffery F.RayportList II (Ideas)1. Managing in the market space2. Common-sense Direct marketing3. Strategic marketing for the digital age4. On-line marketingChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.I-3, II-2, III-4, IV-1
  • B.I-1, II-2, III-3, IV-4
  • C.I-2, II-1, III-4, IV-3
  • D.I-4, II-3, III-2, IV-1
Correct Answer: I-3, II-2, III-4, IV-1

Bill Bishop:  Strategic marketing for the digital age

D. Bird: Common-sense Direct marketing

Daniel S. Jonal: On-line marketing

Jeffery F. Rayport: Managing in the market space

Question 11
Which of the following retail analytic applications involve(s) the use of search techniques to gain insights into customer’s buying pattern? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)I. Factor analysisII. Regression analysisIII. Data miningIV. Data scrappingV. Data cloningChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.I, II only
  • B.II, III only
  • C.I, III, IV only
  • D.III only
Correct Answer: III only

The retail analytic application that involves the use of search techniques to gain insights into customer's buying patterns is (D) III only.

 

Data mining is a process of discovering patterns, trends, and relationships within large datasets. In the context of retail, data mining techniques can be applied to customer transaction data to uncover valuable information about buying patterns, customer preferences, and behaviors. It involves searching for hidden patterns and correlations in the data, which can be used for marketing, inventory management, and other retail-related decisions.

Question 12
The characteristics of online and social media marketing are:  (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2021)(1) Personal(2) Rich(3) Timely(4) Interactive(5) Up to dateChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.1, 4 and 5 only
  • B.2 and 5 only
  • C.2, 4 and 5 only
  • D.1, 3 and 4 only
Correct Answer: 2, 4 and 5 only

The correct answer is (C) 2, 4, and 5 only.

  • Rich: Online and social media marketing often involve multimedia elements such as videos, images, and interactive content.
  • Interactive: Online and social media platforms allow for interaction and engagement with the audience, enabling two-way communication.
  • Up to date: Online and social media platforms provide real-time updates and current information to the audience.
Question 13
Which of the following are the main platforms for social media? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2022)(a) Search Engines.(b) Online communities and forums.(c) Blogs(d) Social Networks.(e) Web 1.0Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.b, c and d only.
  • B.b and d only.
  • C.b, c, d and e only.
  • D.a, b, c and d only.
Correct Answer: b, c and d only.

The main platforms for social media, as listed in the question, are:

 

(b) Online communities and forums.

(c) Blogs

(d) Social Networks.

 

These platforms are commonly used for social media interactions and content sharing. Option (A) includes these platforms, so the correct answer is (A) b, c, and d only.

Question 14
Match List I with List II: (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2022)List I (Promotional Campaign):(a) #StayStrongMoms(b) #JeetKiOre(c) #LetsunstereotypeIndia(d) #FreedomtoloveList II (Company):(i) Pepsin India(ii) Hindustan Unilever (HUL)(iii) Indian Tobacco Company (ITC)(iv) Brooke Bond IndiaChoose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.a- iii, b-i, c- iv, d- ii
  • B.a- ii, b- iv, c-i, d- iii
  • C.a- ii, b-i, c- iii, d- iv
  • D.a-i, b- iii, c- iv, d- ii
Correct Answer: a- iii, b-i, c- iv, d- ii

The correct match between the Promotional Campaign (List I) and the Company (List II) is as follows:

(a) #StayStrongMoms - Indian Tobacco Company (ITC)

(b) #JeetKiOre - Pepsin India

(c) #LetsunstereotypeIndia - Brooke Bond India

(d) #Freedomtolove - Hindustan Unilever (HUL)

 

So, the correct answer is (A) a- iii, b- i, c- iv, d- ii.

Question 15
An enormous collection of data on various topics from a variety of internal and external sources, compiled by a firm for its own use or for use by its clients, is called: (UGC NET Commerce July 2018)
  • A.Data-base
  • B.Data warehouse
  • C.Data mining
  • D.M.I.S.
Correct Answer: Data warehouse

The correct answer is (B) Data warehouse.

 

A data warehouse is a comprehensive collection of data from various sources, both internal and external to an organization. It is organized in a way that facilitates reporting, analysis, and other business intelligence activities. The purpose of a data warehouse is to store and manage large volumes of data to support decision-making processes within an organization.

Question 16
Match the following.List I (Customer Databases)(a) Customer database(b) Database marketing(c) Customer mailing list(d) Business databaseList II (Description)(i) Process of building, maintaining, and using customer databases to build customer relationships.(ii) Set of customers names, addresses, and telephone numbers.(iii) Contains customers’ past purchases; past volumes, prices, and profits; buyer team member names.(iv) Organized collection of comprehensive information about individual customers.Choose the correct option using the codes given below:Codes
  • A.a-(iv) b-(ii) c-(i) d-(iii)
  • B.a-(ii) b-(iii) c-(iv) d-(i)
  • C.a-(iv) b-(i) c-(ii) d-(iii)
  • D.a-(iii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(ii)
Correct Answer: a-(iv) b-(i) c-(ii) d-(iii)

Marketers must know their customers. And in order to know the customer, the company must collect information and store it in a database from which to conduct Database marketing.

 

Customer database is an organized collection of comprehensive information about individual customers or prospects that is current, accessible, and actionable for lead generation, lead qualification, sale of a product or service, or maintenance of customer relationships.

 

Database marketing is the process of building, maintaining, and using customer databases and other databases (products, suppliers, resellers) to contact, transact, and build customer relationships.

 

Customer mailing list is simply a set of names, addresses, and telephone numbers. A customer database contains much more information, accumulated through customer transactions, registration information, telephone queries, cookies, and every customer contact and not to be confuse with a customer database.

 

Business database contains business customers’ past purchases; past volumes, prices, and profits; buyer team member names (and ages, birthdays, hobbies, and favorite foods); status of current contracts; an estimate of the supplier’s share of the customer’s business; competitive suppliers; assessment of competitive strengths and weaknesses in selling and servicing the account; and relevant customer buying practices, patterns, and policies.

Question 17
In __________ marketers can capture, query, andanalyzethem to draw inferences about an individual customer’s needs and responses
  • A.data warehouse
  • B.data mines
  • C.customer database
  • D.business database
Correct Answer: data warehouse

In data warehouse marketers can capture, query, and analyze them to draw inferences about an individual customer’s needs and responses.

 

Savvy companies capture information every time a customer comes into contact with any of their departments, whether it is a customer purchase, a customer-requested service call, or an online query. These data are collected by the company’s contact center and organized into data warehouse. Telemarketers can respond to customer inquiries based on a complete picture of the customer relationship, and customized marketing activities can be directed to individual customers.

Question 18
The extent to which a Web site facilitates efficient and effective shopping, purchasing, and delivery is called:
  • A.Online Service Quality
  • B.Online Service Delivery
  • C.Online Platform Quality
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Online Service Quality

The correct answer is (A) Online Service Quality.

 

Online Service Quality refers to the extent to which a website or online platform facilitates efficient and effective shopping, purchasing, and delivery processes for users. It encompasses various factors such as website usability, reliability, responsiveness, and overall user experience related to online services.

Question 19
Match the following.List - I (e - Commerce Companies)(a)VoyllaRetail(b)Limeroad(c) First cry.com(d)PepperfryList – II (Product Categories)(i) Kids and baby products(ii) Imitation Jewellery(iii) Furniture and home decor(iv) Fashion and life styleCodes
  • A.a-(i) b-(iii) c-(ii) d-(iv)
  • B.a-(iii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(ii)
  • C.a-(ii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(iii)
  • D.a-(ii) b-(i) c-(iv) d-(iii)
Correct Answer: a-(ii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(iii)

- Voylla Retail is a company into imitation jewelry with both online and physical presence.

- Limeroad is an online fashion and lifestyle brand.

- First cry.com is into kids and baby products which has physical stores as well.

- Pepperfry is mainly an online furniture and home décor company.

Question 20
Best-selling author Malcolm Gladwell claims 3 factors work to ignite public interest in an idea. Which among the following is NOT one of the factors?
  • A.The Power of context
  • B.The Law of the Few
  • C.To cultivate bees
  • D.Stickiness
Correct Answer: To cultivate bees

Well known public speaker and author Malcolm Gladwell claims 3 factors work to ignite public interest in an idea.

 

(i) According to the first, “The Law of the Few,” 3 types of people help to spread an idea like an epidemic. First are Mavens, people knowledgeable about big and small things. Second are Connectors, people who know and communicate with a great number of other people. Third are Salesmen, who possess natural persuasive power. Any idea that catches the interest of Mavens, Connectors, and Salesmen is likely to be broadcast far and wide.

(ii) The second factor is “Stickiness.” An idea must be expressed so that it motivates people to act. Otherwise, “The Law of the Few” will not lead to a self-sustaining epidemic.

(iii) Finally, the third factor, “The Power of Context,” controls whether those spreading an idea are able to organize groups and communities around it.

 

However, not everyone agrees with Gladwell’s ideas. One team of viral marketing experts caution that although influencers start trends, they are often too introspective and socially alienated to spread them. They advise marketers to cultivate “bees”, hyper-devoted customers who are not just satisfied knowing about the next trend but live to spread the word. More firms are in fact finding ways to actively engage their passionate brand evangelists.

Question 21
Which of the following is NOT a traditional direct marketing tool?
  • A.Blog marketing
  • B.Kiosk marketing
  • C.Telemarketing
  • D.Catalogmarketing
Correct Answer: Blog marketing

Traditional direct marketing tools include face-to-face selling, direct-mail marketing, catalog marketing, telemarketing, direct-response television marketing, and kiosk marketing. In recent years, however, a dazzling new set of digital direct marketing tools has burst onto the marketing scene, including online marketing (websites, online ads and promotions, email, online videos, and blogs), social media marketing, and mobile marketing.

 

Traditional direct marketing tools:

1) Face-to-face Marketing – It is one of the oldest forms of direct marketing. Most business-to-business marketers rely heavily on a professional sales force to locate prospects, develop them into customers, build lasting relationships and grow the business or they hire manufacturers' representatives and agents to carry out the direct selling task.

2) Direct-mail Marketing – It involves mailings of letters, ads, samples, foldouts and other 'salespeople on wings' sent to prospects on mailing lists.

3) Catalog Marketing - It involves selling through catalogues mailed to a select list of customers or made available in stores. In India Big Bazaar, Croma and Hypercity have started using catalog to increase footfalls in their stores. Big Bazaar is to use catalogs in about 50-55 stores. Catalogs not only help in Brand recalls but it can be also used for promoting new offerings.

4) Telemarketing - uses the telephone to sell directly to consumers. It has become a primary direct marketing tool. Marketers use outbound telephone marketing in a proactive way to generate and qualify sales leads, and sell directly to consumers and businesses. Calls may also be for research, testing, database building or appointment making, as a follow-up to a previous contact, or as part of a motivation or customer-care programme.

5) Direct-response Television Marketing – The marketing of products or services via television commercials and programmes which involve a responsive clement, typically with the use of a toll-free number that allows consumers to phone for more information or to place an order for the goods advertised. For example, TV channels in India like Naaptol and Home-Shop 18.

6) Kiosk Marketing – Kiosk marketing is a marketing involving a supplier and a buyer. It is a kind of direct marketing or B2B marketing. This is because kiosks are usually handled by small to large business sectors.

 

Modern direct marketing tools:

1) Online Marketing – It is a form of direct marketing conducted through interactive online computer services, which provide two-way systems that link consumers with sellers electronically. For example, websites, online advertising, emails, online videos, blogs etc.

2) Social Media Marketing – It involves use of social media like Facebook, WhatsApp, and Twitter etc. to market goods and services to targeted audience.

3) Mobile Marketing – It involves using mobile applications.

 

It is important that all of these tools—both the new digital and the more traditional forms—must be blended into a fully integrated marketing communications program.

 

Digital and social media marketing is the fastest-growing form of direct marketing. It uses digital marketing tools such as websites, online video, email, blogs, social media, mobile ads and apps, and other digital platforms to directly engage consumers anywhere, anytime via their computers, smartphones, tablets, internet ready TVs, and other digital devices. The widespread use of the internet and digital technologies is having a dramatic impact on both buyers and the marketers who serve them.

Question 22
A type of digital advertisement that appears superimposed over the requested websites’ content is termed as:
  • A.Floating Ad
  • B.Pop-ups
  • C.Expanding Ad
  • D.Interstitial Ad
Correct Answer: Floating Ad

Types of Digital Advertisements:

 

Frame ad (traditional banner) - Frame ads were the first form of web banners. The colloquial usage of "banner ads" often refers to traditional frame ads. Website publishers incorporate frame ads by setting aside a particular space on the web page.

 

Pop-ups/pop-unders - A pop-up ad is displayed in a new web browser window that opens above a website visitor's initial browser window. A pop-under ad opens a new browser window under a website visitor's initial browser window.

 

Floating ad - A floating ad, or overlay ad, is a type of rich media advertisement that appears superimposed over the requested website's content. Floating ads may disappear or become less obtrusive after a preset time period.

 

Expanding ad - An expanding ad is a rich media frame ad that changes dimensions upon a predefined condition, such as a preset amount of time a visitor spends on a webpage, the user's click on the ad, or the user's mouse movement over the ad. Expanding ads allow advertisers to fit more information into a restricted ad space.

 

Interstitial ad - An interstitial ad displays before a user can access requested content, sometimes while the user is waiting for the content to load. Interstitial ads are a form of interruption marketing.

 

Text ads - A text ad displays text-based hyperlinks. Text-based ads may display separately from a web page's primary content, or they can be embedded by hyperlinking individual words or phrases to advertiser's websites. Text ads may also be delivered through email marketing or text message marketing.

Question 23
Which of the following is a form of online ad which appears between 2 content pages while visiting a website?
  • A.Viral Marketing
  • B.Micro-sites
  • C.Interstitials
  • D.Contextual placements
Correct Answer: Interstitials

Interstitial Ad – It is an ad, which appears between two content pages while visiting a website or by extension an ad displayed before accessing the homepage. An interstitial takes up the full extent of the browser window and disappears after a few seconds to allow access to the intended page.

 

Micro-sites - A micro-site is an individual web page or small cluster of web pages that act as a separate entity for a brand. A micro-site typically lives on its own domain, but some exist as a sub-domain.

 

Viral Marketing - Viral marketing seeks to spread information about a product or service from person to person by word of mouth or sharing via the internet or email. The goal of viral marketing is to inspire individuals to share a marketing message to friends, family and other individuals to create exponential growth in the number of its recipients.

 

Contextual Placements - Advertising on a website that is targeted to the specific individual who is visiting the Web site. A contextual ad system scans the text of a Web site for keywords and returns ads to the Web page based on what the user is viewing, either through ads placed on the page or pop-up ads.

Question 24
_________ is designed to increase a website's visibility in search engine results pages.
  • A.SEO
  • B.SEM
  • C.CRM
  • D.PPC
Correct Answer: SEM

Search Engine Marketing (SEM) - Search Engine Marketing, or SEM, is designed to increase a website's visibility in search engine results pages (SERPs) primarily through paid advertising. Search engines provide sponsored results and organic (non-sponsored) results based on a web searcher's query. Search engine marketing includes all of an advertiser's actions to make a website's listing more prominent for topical keywords.

 

This type of online marketing is also commonly referred to as Pay-Per-Click (PPC) advertising because you generally pay a certain amount each time somebody clicks on your ad, although there are also options for paying per thousand impressions on many online ad platforms.

Since, SEM is a broader term which includes PPC therefore, answer is SEM.

 

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) -Search Engine Optimization, or SEO, attempts to improve a website's organic search rankings in SERPs by increasing the website content's relevance to search terms. Search engines regularly update their algorithms to penalize poor quality sites that try to game their rankings, making optimization a moving target for advertisers. Many vendors offer SEO services.

 

Customer Relationship Management (CRM) refers to identification, satisfaction, and management of customers’ stated and unstated needs and demands by the retailer for mutual benefit.

Question 25
A technique used in marketing a product or a service where users help in spreading the advertiser’s message to other people or creates a scenario which leads to multi-fold growth is called:
  • A.Blogging
  • B.Viral Marketing
  • C.Email Marketing
  • D.Online Forums
Correct Answer: Viral Marketing

Viral marketing – It refers to a technique in marketing a product or a service where users help in spreading the advertiser's message to other websites or the users create a scenario which can lead to multi-fold growth. It is the digital version of word-of-mouth marketing, involves creating videos, ads, and other marketing content that are so infectious that customers will seek them out or pass them along to their friends. Because customers find and pass along the content, viral marketing can be very inexpensive. In addition, when content comes from a friend, the recipient is much more likely to view or read it.

 

Blogs and Online Forum - Brands also conduct online marketing through various digital forums that appeal to specific special-interest groups and brand communities. Blogs (or web logs) are online forums where people and companies post their thoughts and other content, usually related to narrowly defined topics. Blogs can be about anything, from politics or baseball to haiku, car repair, brands, or the latest television series. Many bloggers use social networks such as Twitter, Facebook, Tumblr, and Instagram to promote their blogs, giving them huge reach.

 

Email Marketing – This remains an important and growing digital marketing tool. “Social media is the hot new thing,” says one observer, “but email is still the king.” Around the world, more than 200 million emails are sent out every minute of every day. According to one account, 72 percent of adults prefer that companies communicate with them via email, and 91 percent say they like receiving promotional emails from companies with which they do business.

Question 26
In marketing 'SEM' means
  • A.Search-Engine-Marketing
  • B.Strategy-Engine-Money
  • C.Sales-Engine-Management
  • D.Sales-Even-Money
Correct Answer: Search-Engine-Marketing

SEM stands for Search Engine Marketing. It is a type of internet-based marketing associated with the researching, submitting and positioning of a website within search engines to achieve maximum visibility and to increase company’s share of paid and/or organic traffic referrals from search engines. SEM involves things such as search engine optimization (SEO), keyword research, competitive analysis, paid listings and other search engine services that will increase search traffic to your site.

Question 27
Which one of the following refers to the use of online and offline promotion techniques to increase the audience of a site? (UGC NET Management Nov 2017)
  • A.Search-engine optimization
  • B.Traffic building campaign
  • C.Search-engine marketing
  • D.Quality score
Correct Answer: Traffic building campaign

Traffic-building campaign is the use of online and offline promotion techniques such as banner advertising, search engine promotion and reciprocal linking to increase the audience of a site (both new and existing customers).

 

Search Engine Optimization (SEO) is the process of maximizing the number of visitors to a particular website by ensuring that the site appears high on the list of results returned by a search engine.

 

Search Engine Marketing (SEM) is a form of Internet marketing that involves the promotion of websites by increasing their visibility in search engine results pages (SERPs) primarily through paid advertising. SEM may or may not incorporate search engine optimization (SEO).

 

Quality Score is Google's rating of the quality and relevance of both your keywords and ads. It is used to determine your cost per click (CPC) and multiplied by your maximum bid to determine your ad rank in the ad auction process.

Question 28
Creating the capability of making purchases directly from a firm’s website is known as: (UGC NET Commerce Jan 2017)
  • A.Electronic Networking
  • B.Electronic Transactions
  • C.Electronic Data Interchange
  • D.Electronic Information System
Correct Answer: Electronic Transactions

An Electronic Transaction is the sale or purchase of goods or services, whether between businesses, households, individuals, governments, and other public or private organisations, conducted over computer-mediated networks. The goods and services are ordered over those networks, but the payment and the ultimate delivery of the good or service may be conducted on or off-line.

Electronic Data Interchange (EDI) is the electronic interchange of business information using a standardized format; a process which allows one company to send information to another company electronically rather than with paper. Business entities conducting business electronically are called trading partners.

E-Networking OR Electronic Networking is a process and resource that takes traditional networking techniques and launches them into cyberspace. It allows you to create a community of virtual contacts who can provide critical information on industry trends, possible job openings and contact names for your job search.

Electronic Information System: A system which stores information from internal and external sources to facilitate better decision making. The data is collated in a database and the user can access the files to glean better information as a basis for decision. The system may include fiscal, social, economic, scientific or technical data geared to support a firm's operations.

Question 29
Which of the following is NOT a major aspect of Digital Marketing? (UGC NET Commerce Nov 2017)
  • A.Jurisdiction
  • B.Ownership
  • C.Security
  • D.Entertainment
Correct Answer: Entertainment

Entertainment is not a major aspect of digital marketing as the main motive of any digital marketing process is to make customers aware about the particular product and impart knowledge about it such as price, availability, features, functions and other benefits.

Question 30
Which form of e-market place brings together buyers and sellers from the same industry? (UGC NET Commerce Aug 2016)
  • A.Horizontal
  • B.Vertical
  • C.Integrated
  • D.Inclined
Correct Answer: Vertical

There are many different types of e-marketplace based on a range of business models. They can be broadly divided into categories based on the way in which they are operated:

 

A Vertical e-marketplace provide online access to businesses vertically up and down every segment of a particular industry.

 

A Horizontal e-marketplace connects buyers and sellers across different industries or regions.

 

An independent e-marketplace is usually a business-to-business online platform operated by a third party which is open to buyers or sellers in a particular industry. By registering on an independent e-marketplace, you can access classified ads or requests for quotations or bids in your industry sector. There will typically be some form of payment required to participate.

 

A buyer-oriented e-marketplace is normally run by a consortium of buyers in order to establish an efficient purchasing environment. If you are looking to purchase, participating in this sort of e-marketplace can help you lower your administrative costs and achieve the best price from suppliers. As a supplier you can use a buyer-oriented e-marketplace to advertise your catalogue to a pool of relevant customers who are looking to buy.

 

A Supplier-oriented e-marketplace also known as a supplier directory, this marketplace is set up and operated by a number of suppliers who are seeking to establish an efficient sales channel via the internet to a large number of buyers. They are usually searchable by the product or service being offered.

 

Supplier directories benefit buyers by providing information about suppliers for markets and regions they may not be familiar with. Sellers can use these types of marketplace to increase their visibility to potential buyers and to get leads.

There do not exist any e-marketplace named as Inclined or Integrated.

Question 31
Consider the following statements relating to online marketing:Statement I:Online communities and forums come in only one shape and size.Statement II:In paid search, marketers bid in a continuous auction on search terms that serve as a proxy for the consumer’s product or consumption interest.Statement III:Marketers must recognize that only some consumers want to engage with some brands.Codes:(UGC NET Management Jul 2016)
  • A.Only statements I and II are correct.
  • B.Only statements II and III are correct.
  • C.Only statements I and III are correct.
  • D.All the statements are correct.
Correct Answer: Only statements II and III are correct.

Online communities and forums never come only in one shape and size as we can see examples of blogs, social media websites, mobile apps or social media forums.

 

Paid search marketing is known in the marketing and advertising industry by many different names (and abbreviations). Search Engine Marketing (SEM, which can include SEO), Pay-Per-Click (PPC), search engine advertising, sponsored listings etc. And that’s before you start to involve the names of specific advertising programmes and ad types, such as Google Ads (formerly Google AdWords), Google Product Listing Ads, Google Shopping Ads, and Bing Ads.

 

Marketers must recognize that only some customers recognize with few brands exclusively and some with others and show brand loyalty.

Question 32
Which fact is true about online marketing?
  • A.A website which is user friendly.
  • B.A website which is user friendly and regularly updated.
  • C.A website which is user friendly, regularly updated and make product’s graphical image available.
  • D.A website which is user friendly, regularly updated, provides product’s graphical image and product’s price is competitive.
Correct Answer: A website which is user friendly, regularly updated, provides product’s graphical image and product’s price is competitive.

Online marketing is a set of tools and methodologies used for promoting products and services through the internet. Online marketing includes a wider range of marketing elements than traditional business marketing due to the extra channels and marketing mechanisms available on the internet. A website is one of them. A good website should be: Functional, Easiness (user friendly), Relevant Content (regularly updated), Modern, Optimized, Responsive, Performance (product’s graphical image) and Speed, Reliable (product’s price is competitive), Scalable, Secure.

Question 33
Which one of the following facilitates E-Commerce? (UGC NETManagement Jun 2012)
  • A.Public relations
  • B.Direct marketing
  • C.Personal selling
  • D.Product quality
Correct Answer: Direct marketing

Ecommerce, also known as electronic commerce or internet commerce, refers to the buying and selling of goods or services using the internet, and the transfer of money and data to execute these transactions. Ecommerce is often used to refer to the sale of physical products online, but it can also describe any kind of commercial transaction that is facilitated through the internet. Direct marketing is the phenomenon where marketers reach to the customers directly through various tools like direct mail, face-to-face, kiosk, email etc. These are traditional forms, but now-a-days with the emergence of internet and other technologies e-commerce is also facilitated by direct marketing.

 

Whereas e-business refers to all aspects of operating an online business, ecommerce refers specifically to the transaction of goods and services. There are 4 main types of ecommerce models that can describe almost every transaction that takes place between consumers and businesses.

 

1. Business to Consumer (B2C): 
When a business sells a good or service to an individual consumer (e.g. You buy a pair of shoes from an online retailer).

 

2. Business to Business (B2B): 
When a business sells a good or service to another business (e.g. A business sells software-as-a-service for other businesses to use)  

3. Consumer to Consumer (C2C): 
When a consumer sells a good or service to another consumer (e.g. You sell your old furniture on eBay to another consumer).

4. Consumer to Business (C2B): 
When a consumer sells their own products or services to a business or organization (e.g. An influencer offers exposure to their online audience in exchange for a fee, or a photographer licenses their photo for a business to use).

Question 34
The Facebook, popularly used for online marketing, was founded in which year and by whom? (UGC NET ManagementJul 2016)
  • A.2004, Peter Corbett
  • B.2005, Peter Corbett
  • C.2004, Mark Zuckerberg
  • D.2005, Mark Zuckerberg
Correct Answer: 2004, Mark Zuckerberg

The Facebook, popularly used for online marketing, was founded in 2004, by Mark Zuckerberg.

Question 35
___________ is a marketing strategy that uses two-way communication channels to allow consumers to connect with a company directly.
  • A.Direct Marketing
  • B.Interactive Marketing
  • C.Communicating Marketing
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Interactive Marketing

Interactive Marketing is a marketing strategy that uses two-way communication channels to allow consumers to connect with a company directly. The newest and fastest-growing channels for two-way communication and selling directly to customers are electronic. The Internet provides marketers and consumers with opportunities for much greater interaction and individualization.

 

The variety of online communication options means companies can send tailored messages that engage consumers by reflecting their special interests and behavior. The Internet is also highly accountable and its effects can be easily traced by noting how many unique visitors or “UVs” click on a page or ad, how long they spend with it, and where they go afterward.

Question 36
JeffreyRayportand Bernard Jaworski propose that effective website features 7 design elements they call the 7Cs. Identify among the following which is NOT included in 7C's.(i) Community(ii) Care(iii) Connection(iv) Customization(v) Convergence(vi) CommerceChoose the correct answer using the codes given below:Codes
  • A.(i) and (vi)
  • B.(i) and (ii)
  • C.(ii) and (v)
  • D.(iii) and (v)
Correct Answer: (ii) and (v)

A company chooses which forms of interactive marketing will be most cost-effective in achieving communication and sales objectives. Some of the main categories of Interactive Marketing are: (i) Web sites, (ii) search ads, (iii) display ads, and (iv) e-mails.

 

Web Sites: Companies must design Web sites that embody or express their purpose, history, products, and vision and that are attractive on first viewing and interesting enough to encourage repeat visits. Jeffrey Rayport and Bernard Jaworski propose that effective sites feature seven design elements they call the 7Cs.

 

Context: Layout and design

Content: Text, pictures, sound, and video the site contains.

Community: How the site enables user-to-user communication.

Customization: Site’s ability to tailor itself to different users or to allow users to personalize the site.

Communication: How the site enables site-to-user, user-to-site, or two-way communication

Connection: Degree that the site is linked to other sites

Commerce: Site’s capabilities to enable commercial transactions

 

To encourage repeat visits, companies must pay special attention to context and content factors and embrace another “C” i.e. constant change.

Question 37
Individual Web pages or clusters of pages that function as supplements to a primary site are called:
  • A.Supplementary sites
  • B.Microsites
  • C.Interstitials
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Microsites

Individual Web pages or clusters of pages that function as supplements to a primary site are called Microsites. They’re particularly relevant for companies selling low-interest products. For instance, people rarely visit an insurance company’s Web site, but the company can create a microsite on used-car sites that offers advice for buyers of used cars and at the same time a good insurance deal.

 

Visitors will judge a website’s performance on ease of use and physical attractiveness.

(i) Ease of use means: (a) The site downloads quickly, (b) the first page is easy to understand, and (c) it is easy to navigate to other pages that open quickly.

(ii) Physical attractiveness is assured when: (a) Individual pages are clean and not crammed with content, (b) typefaces and font sizes are very readable, and (c) the site makes good use of color (and sound).

Marketing website: A website that engages consumers to move them closer to a direct purchase or other marketing outcome.

Brand community website: A website that presents brand content that engages consumers and creates customer community around a band.

Question 38
__________ is the marketers bid on search terms, when a consumer searches for those words using Search engine on internet, the marketer’s ad will appear on the results page, and advertisers pay only if people click on links.
  • A.Paid Search
  • B.Search Engine Optimization
  • C.Search Bidding
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Paid Search

Some of the main categories of Interactive Marketing are: (1) Web sites, (2) search ads, (3) display ads, and (4) e-mails.

 

In Paid Search, marketers bid in a continuous auction on search terms that serve as a proxy for the consumer’s product or consumption interests. When a consumer searches for any of the words with Google, Yahoo!, or Bing, the marketer’s ad may appear above or next to the results, depending on the amount the company bids and an algorithm the search engines use to determine an ad’s relevance to a particular search.

Advertisers pay only if people click on the links, but marketers believe consumers who have already expressed interest by engaging in search are prime prospects. The cost per click depends on how high the link is ranked and the popularity of the keyword.

Question 39
Small, rectangular boxes containing text and perhaps a picture that companies pay to place on relevant Web sites are called
  • A.Paid Search
  • B.Display ads
  • C.Interstitials
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Display ads

Some of the main categories of Interactive Marketing are: (1) Web sites, (2) search ads, (3) display ads, and (4) e-mails.

 

Display ads or banner ads are small, rectangular boxes containing text and perhaps a picture that companies pay to place on relevant Web sites. The larger the audience, the higher the cost. Some banners are accepted on a barter basis. In the early days of the Internet, viewers clicked on an average of 2 to 3 % of the banner ads they saw, but that average percentage quickly plummeted to as little as 0.25 % and advertisers began to explore other forms of communication. Hence, these ads need to be more attention-getting and influential, better targeted, and more closely tracked.

Question 40
Advertisements, often with video or animation, which pop up between changes on a Web site are called
  • A.Paid Search
  • B.Display ads
  • C.Interstitials
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Interstitials

Interstitials are advertisements, often with video or animation, which pop up between changes on a Web site. For example, ads for Johnson & Johnson’s Tylenol headache reliever would pop up on brokers’ Web sites whenever the stock market fell by 100 points or more. Because consumers find pop-up ads intrusive and distracting, many use software to block them.

Question 41
Through _________, marketers can measure what people read on a computer screen by using cameras attached to a computer that track eye movements.
  • A.Interstitials
  • B.Behavioural Targeting
  • C.Heat Mapping
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Heat Mapping

Through Heat Mapping, marketers can measure what people read on a computer screen by using cameras attached to a computer that track eye movements. One study showed that clickable graphic icons and buttons that linked to more details of a marketing offer increased click-through rates by fair percentage over links that used just an Internet address.

Question 42
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Some firms are asking consumers to say whether and when they would like to receive emails.Statement II:Online customers demand a positive exit experience.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

Some of the main categories of Interactive Marketing are: (1) Web sites, (2) search ads, (3) display ads, and (4) e-mails.

 

E-mail marketing: Sending highly targeted, highly personalized, relationship-building marketing messages via email.

 

Email allows marketers to inform and communicate with customers at a fraction of the cost of a “d-mail,” or direct mail, campaign. Consumers are besieged by e-mails, though, and many employ spam filters. Some firms are asking consumers to say whether and when they would like to receive email.

 

E-mails must be timely, targeted, and relevant. Measures to maximize the Marketing Value of E-mails:

(i) Give the customer a reason to respond.

(ii) Personalize the content of your e-mails.

(iii) Because e-mail campaigns can be carried out quickly, they can offer time-sensitive information.

(iv) Make it easy for customers to “unsubscribe.” Online customers demand a positive exit experience. Dissatisfied customers leaving on a sour note are more likely to spread the displeasure to others.

(v) Combine with other communications such as social media.

 

Spam: Unsolicited, unwanted, commercial email messages.

Question 43
________ are​ “bite-sized” software programs that can be loaded onto smartphones.
  • A.SMS text messages
  • B.Mobile coupons
  • C.Mobile apps
  • D.Mobile display ads
Correct Answer: Mobile apps

Mobile apps are “bite-sized” software programs that can be loaded on to smart phones. In a short period of time, thousands were introduced by companies large and small.

 

Mobile Marketing: Marketing messages, promotions, and other content delivered to on-the-go consumers through their mobile devises.

 

Benefits of Mobile Marketing:

With cell phones’ ubiquitous nature and marketers’ ability to personalize messages based on demographics and other consumer behaviour characteristics, the appeal of mobile marketing as a communication tool is obvious.

 

Smart phones allow loyalty programs with which customers can track their visits and purchases at a merchant and receive rewards. By tracking the location of receptive customers who opt in to receive communications, retailers can send them location-specific promotions when they are in proximity to shops or outlets.

 

With traditional coupon redemption rates declining for years, the ability of cell phones to permit more relevant and timely offers to consumers at or near the point of purchase has piqued the interest of many marketers. These new coupons can take all forms; digital in-store signs can now dispense them to smart phone.

 

Omni-channel retailing: Creating a seamless cross-channel buying experience that integrates in-store, online, and mobile shopping.

Question 44
