The marketing Vice President, or the CMO, must usually work through persuasion rather than through authority to (i) coordinate the company’s internal marketing activities and (ii) coordinate marketing with finance, operations, and other company functions to serve the customer. To help marketing and other functions jointly determine what is in the company’s best interests, firms can provide joint seminars, joint committees and liaison employees, employee exchange programs, and analytical methods to determine the most profitable course of action.

 

Many companies now focus on key processes rather than departments, because departmental organization can be a barrier to smooth performance. They appoint process leaders, who manage cross-disciplinary teams that include marketing and sales people. Marketers thus may have a solid-line responsibility to their teams and a dotted-line responsibility to the marketing department.

Question 6
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Strategy and Implementation are closely related. For example, top management’s strategic decision to “harvest” a product must be translated into specific actions and assignments.Statement II:Implementation addresses the what and why of marketing activities; strategy addresses the who, where, when, and how.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect

Marketing implementation is the process that turns marketing plans into action assignments and ensures they accomplish the plan’s stated objectives. A brilliant strategic marketing plan counts for little if not implemented properly.

 

Strategy addresses the what and why of marketing activities; implementation addresses the who, where, when, and how. They are closely related: One layer of strategy implies certain tactical implementation assignments at a lower level. For example, top management’s strategic decision to “harvest” a product must be translated into specific actions and assignments. Companies today are also striving to make their marketing operations more efficient and their return on marketing investment more measurable.

 

Marketing Resource Management (MRM) software provides a set of web-based applications that automate and integrate project management, campaign management, budget management, asset management, brand management, customer relationship management, and knowledge management. Software packages can provide what some have called desktop marketing, giving marketers information and decision structures on computer dashboards. MRM software lets marketers improve spending and investment decisions, bring new products to market more quickly, and reduce decision time and costs.

Question 7
Arrange the correct order of Modern Organization Chart from top to bottom.(i) Middle Management(ii) Customers(iii) Top Management(iv) Front line PeopleCodes
  • A.(ii), (iv), (i), (iii)
  • B.(i), (ii), (iv), (iii)
  • C.(ii), (iv), (iii), (i)
  • D.(i), (iii), (iv), (ii)
Correct Answer: (ii), (iv), (i), (iii)

The correct order is from top to bottom: customers, front line people, Middle Management, Top Management.

Successful marketing companies put customers at the top; next in importance are frontline people who meet, serve, and satisfy customers; under them are the middle managers, whose job is to support the frontline people so they can serve customers well; and at the base is Top Management, whose job is to hire and support good middle managers.

We have added customers along the sides (as shown in the Figure) to indicate that managers at every level must be personally involved in knowing, meeting, and serving customers.

 

Question 8
The most common form of organizing the Marketing Department is based on:(UGC NET Management Dec 2014)
  • A.Customer
  • B.Functions
  • C.Geography
  • D.Product
Correct Answer: Functions

Functional organisation is the most common and widely practiced form of marketing organisation. It consists of functional-marketing specialists (Functional Heads) reporting to marketing manager. Marketing manager (Marketing Vice-President) is the Head of Marketing Department and is responsible to coordinate marketing activities.

Quiz Attempt #119620

Total Questions: 63
Question 1
The present value of future profits, the individual or segment will generate over a lifetime relationship with a brand or firm, is known as(UGC NET Commerce Dec 2023)
  • A.Lifelong Value
  • B.Lifetime Value
  • C.Longlife Value
  • D.Longterm value
Correct Answer: Lifetime Value

Lifetime value refers to the present value of the future profits that an individual or segment will generate over their lifetime relationship with a brand or firm. It is a key metric used in marketing and customer relationship management to assess the long-term value of acquiring and retaining customers.

Question 2
Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) in the first year is (UGC NET Management Dec 2019)
  • A.CLV (1) = m ×r(1+d)
  • B.CLV (1) = m +r(1+d)
  • C.CLV (1) = m -r(1-d)
  • D.CLV (1) = m ×r(1-d)
Correct Answer: CLV (1) = m ×r(1+d)

CLV is the projected total economic value a customer brings to your business over their “lifetime” i.e., the duration of time they will spend with your company, from first interaction to final purchase. Formula to calculate CLV is given below:

 

Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) = m × r1+d

 

Where, m = Gross contributions per customer

r = Yearly Retention Rate

d = i – r (yearly discount rate – yearly retention rate)

i = Yearly discount rate

Question 3
Which out of the following is NOT true about consumer satisfaction? [UGC NETManagement June 2019]
  • A.Consumer satisfaction is a post consumption phenomenon
  • B.Consumer satisfaction is a mild, positive emotional state resulting from a favourable appraisal of a consumption outcome
  • C.Consumer satisfaction results from a cognitive appraisal
  • D.Consumer satisfaction is not different from consumer loyalty. Both are same concepts
Correct Answer: Consumer satisfaction is not different from consumer loyalty. Both are same concepts

The correct option is (D).

 

(A) Consumer satisfaction is a post-consumption phenomenon - This is true. Consumer satisfaction is typically assessed after a customer has used a product or service.

 

(B) Consumer satisfaction is a mild, positive emotional state resulting from a favorable appraisal of a consumption outcome - This is true. Consumer satisfaction is indeed a positive emotional state that arises from the consumer's assessment of their experience with a product or service.

 

(C) Consumer satisfaction results from a cognitive appraisal - This is true. Consumer satisfaction involves a cognitive evaluation of whether the product or service meets or exceeds the consumer's expectations.

 

(D) Consumer satisfaction is not different from consumer loyalty. Both are the same concepts - This is not true. While consumer satisfaction and consumer loyalty are related, they are distinct concepts. Consumer satisfaction refers to a consumer's contentment with a specific transaction or experience, while consumer loyalty refers to a consumer's consistent preference for and repeat purchase of a particular brand or company.

 

Option (D) is incorrect because it incorrectly equates consumer satisfaction and consumer loyalty, which are actually separate concepts in the field of marketing.

Question 4
The ratio between customer's perceived benefits and the resources they use to obtain those benefits is known as [UGC NET Management Jun 2019]
  • A.Customer satisfaction
  • B.Customer value
  • C.Customer retention
  • D.Customer loyalty
Correct Answer: Customer value

The ratio between customer's perceived benefits and the resources they use to obtain those benefits is known as Customer Value.

 

Customer value is the perceived worth a customer place on a product or service relative to its cost. It is the relationship between the benefits a customer receives from a product or service and the resources (such as money, time, effort) they invest to acquire and use it. Customer value is a key concept in marketing, and businesses strive to create offerings that provide higher value to customers compared to competing products or services.

 

Customer Satisfaction: Customer satisfaction refers to a customer's level of contentment with a specific product or service based on their experience. It is a measure of how well a product or service meets or exceeds customer expectations.

 

Customer Retention: Customer retention focuses on maintaining existing customers and preventing them from switching to competitors. It involves strategies to keep customers engaged, satisfied, and loyal.

 

Customer Loyalty: Customer loyalty refers to a customer's consistent preference for and repeat purchase of a particular brand or company. It goes beyond satisfaction and involves a strong emotional and behavioral connection between the customer and the brand.

Question 5
Match List I with List IIList I – Possible level of customer expectationsA. Normative expectationsB. Acceptable expectationsC. Minimum trouble expectationsD. Experience-based expectationsList II – ExampleI. I expect this restaurant to serve me in an adequate manner.II. I expect terrible service from this restaurant but came because price is low.III. Most of the times this restaurant is very good, but when it gets bust the service is slow.IV. As expensive as this restaurant is, it ought to have excellent food and service.Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Management Jun 2022)
  • A.A-IV, B-II, C-I, D-III
  • B.A-IV, B-I, C-III, D-II
  • C.A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III
  • D.A-I, B-IV, C-II, D-III
Correct Answer: A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III

The correct option is (C) A-IV, B-I, C-II, D-III.

 

A. Normative expectations: These are the expectations that customers believe they should receive based on their past experiences and knowledge about the industry. They are a kind of standard or norm for what is considered reasonable.

Example: "As expensive as this restaurant is, it ought to have excellent food and service."

 

B. Acceptable expectations: These are the basic or minimum expectations that customers consider acceptable for a particular product or service. These expectations define the minimum level of performance that customers are willing to tolerate.

Example: "I expect this restaurant to serve me in an adequate manner."

 

C. Minimum trouble expectations: These expectations relate to customers' desire to avoid any inconvenience, hassle, or difficulty when interacting with a product or service.

Example: "I expect terrible service from this restaurant but came because the price is low."

 

D. Experience-based expectations: These expectations are based on customers' past experiences with a particular brand, product, or service. They form as customers gain more experience with a company over time.

Example: "Most of the times this restaurant is very good, but when it gets busy the service is slow."

Question 6
Choose the correct answer from the options given below: (UGC NET Management Jun 2022)
  • A.I, II, III only
  • B.II, III, IV only
  • C.II, III, V only
  • D.I, IV, V only
Correct Answer: II, III, V only

The correct option is (C) II, III, V only.

 

I. Value perceptions increase with quality, service, and price: This statement is not entirely accurate. Value perceptions are influenced by the balance between the quality and service received and the price paid. Higher quality and service should ideally increase value perceptions while maintaining a reasonable price.

 

II. Customer value triad is primarily a combination of quality, service, and price: This statement is true. The customer value triad refers to the interplay between the perceived quality, service, and price of a product or service that contributes to a customer's overall perception of value.

 

III. Marketing is the identification, creation, communication, delivery, and monitoring of customers value: This statement is true. Marketing involves understanding customer needs, creating products/services that meet those needs, communicating the value of the offerings, delivering them to customers, and continuously monitoring customer satisfaction.

 

IV. If the perceived performance of the product matches with perceived expectations, the customer is delighted: This statement is not mentioned among the options, but it is true. When a customer's perceived performance of a product exceeds their expectations, it often leads to customer delight and positive word-of-mouth.

 

V. Satisfaction reflects a person's judgment of a product's perceived performance in relation to expectations: This statement is true. Customer satisfaction is the result of comparing a product's perceived performance (how well it met expectations) with the customer's initial expectations.

Question 7
Which of the following is not a marketing tactic used for designing customer value? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2022)
  • A.Service
  • B.Communication
  • C.Brand
  • D.Incentives
Correct Answer: Communication

The correct answer is (B) Communication.

 

In marketing, communication is indeed a crucial element for conveying value to customers and creating brand awareness, trust, and understanding. However, it is not a direct marketing tactic used for designing customer value; instead, it is a means to convey the value that a product or service offers. The primary tactics used for designing customer value are typically related to the product or service itself, branding, pricing, and incentives, among others. Communication plays a vital role in conveying the value created through these tactics to the target audience.

Question 8
Which of the following reflects the sum of perceived tangible and intangible benefits and costs to a customer? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2019)
  • A.Customer satisfaction
  • B.Customer delight
  • C.Customer value
  • D.Customer expectation
Correct Answer: Customer value

The correct answer is (C) Customer value.

 

Customer value is the sum of perceived tangible (e.g., product features, price) and intangible (e.g., brand image, reputation) benefits and costs that a customer perceives when evaluating a product or service. It's the overall worth a customer attributes to a product or service based on their assessment of the benefits received in relation to the costs incurred. Customer value is a fundamental concept in marketing and is critical for building and maintaining customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Question 9
Which of the following are true about delivering customer value? (UGC NET Commerce Jun 2020)I. A company can go alone in creating customer valueII. Company must work within a broader network of partners to accomplish customer value.III. Individual companies and brands compete; their entire value delivery networks don’t.IV. Individual companies and brands don’t compete; their entire value delivery networks doV. Value = Contribution/cost (offer higher contribution through product or service to clients and lowers the cost)Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
  • A.I and V only
  • B.I, II and V only
  • C.II, III and V only
  • D.II, IV and V only
Correct Answer: II, IV and V only

The correct answer is (D) II, IV, and V only.

 

I. A company can go alone in creating customer value - This statement is not necessarily true. Many companies work within a broader network of partners to create and deliver customer value. Collaborations and partnerships are common in value creation.

 

II. Company must work within a broader network of partners to accomplish customer value - This statement is generally true. Companies often rely on a network of suppliers, distributors, and other partners to effectively deliver value to customers.

 

III. Individual companies and brands compete; their entire value delivery networks don't - This statement is not accurate. In many industries, not only do individual companies and brands compete, but their entire value delivery networks can also compete. The competition can extend to supply chains, distribution channels, and more.

 

IV. Individual companies and brands don't compete; their entire value delivery networks do - This statement is more accurate. While individual companies and brands may compete, they often recognize the importance of collaboration within their value delivery networks to enhance overall customer value.

 

V. Value = Contribution/cost (offer higher contribution through a product or service to clients and lower the cost) - This statement defines the concept of value as the relationship between the contribution offered to clients and the cost involved. It is a valid definition of value.

Question 10
The concept of achieving maximum profits through increased consumer satisfaction for raised market share focuses on: (UGC NET Commerce Jan 2017)
  • A.Product
  • B.Selling
  • C.Customer
  • D.Production
Correct Answer: Customer

The concept of achieving maximum profits through increased consumer satisfaction and raised market share focuses on (C) "Customer." This approach is known as the marketing concept, which emphasizes understanding and satisfying the needs and wants of customers to achieve business success.

Question 11
What is customer value?(UGC NET Commerce Dec 2012)
  • A.Ratio between the customer’s perceived benefits and the resources used to obtain these benefits.
  • B.Excess of satisfaction over expectation.
  • C.Post purchase dissonance.
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Ratio between the customer’s perceived benefits and the resources used to obtain these benefits.

Customer value is defined as the "Ratio between the customer’s perceived benefits and the resources used to obtain these benefits" (Option A).

 

Customer value represents the perception of the benefits or value that a customer receives from a product or service in comparison to the resources, such as money, time, and effort, that they invest in acquiring or using that product or service. It is a fundamental concept in marketing and is central to understanding customer preferences, decision-making, and satisfaction.

Question 12
Who do buy more, complain less, spread positive word of mouth, ensure a large customer base and repeat business?(UGC NET Commerce Dec 2012)
  • A.Satisfied customers
  • B.Delighted customers
  • C.Industrial customers
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Delighted customers

Customers who buy more, complain less, spread positive word of mouth, ensure a large customer base, and engage in repeat business are typically referred to as "Delighted customers" (Option B).

 

Delighted customers are those who have experienced a level of satisfaction that goes beyond their basic expectations. They are highly satisfied and often become loyal advocates for a brand or company, promoting it through positive word-of-mouth recommendations and continuing to do business with the company. Delighting customers is a key objective for businesses aiming to build strong and lasting customer relationships.

Question 13
Match items in List- II with items in List- I:(UGC NET Commerce Jun 2012)List- Ia. Mega Marketingb. Penetration Pricec. Promotion Mixd. Customer SatisfactionList- IIi. Advertisingii. Kotleriii. Low priceiv. Post Purchase BehaviourCodes:
  • A.a- i, b- ii, c- iii, d- iv
  • B.a- ii, b- iii, c- i, d- iv
  • C.a- iv, b- iii, c- ii, d- i
  • D.a- iii, b- iv, c- i, d- ii
Correct Answer: a- ii, b- iii, c- i, d- iv

The correct matching of items in List-I with items in List-II is as follows:

 

a. Mega Marketing - ii. Kotler

b. Penetration Price - iii. Low price

c. Promotion Mix - i. Advertising

d. Customer Satisfaction - iv. Post Purchase Behaviour

 

So, the correct code is (B) a- ii, b- iii, c- i, d- iv.

Question 14
What is customer delight?(UGC NET Commerce Jun 2012)
  • A.Performance equal to expectation.
  • B.Performance less than expectation.
  • C.Performance more than expectation.
  • D.Expectation more than performance.
Correct Answer: Performance more than expectation.

Customer delight is when the performance of a product or service exceeds the customer's expectations. Therefore, the correct option is (C) Performance more than expectation.

 

Customer delight occurs when customers experience a level of satisfaction that goes beyond what they initially expected. It involves delivering exceptional value or experiences that leave customers pleasantly surprised and highly satisfied with their interaction with a product or service. Delighted customers are more likely to become loyal advocates and promoters of a brand or company.

Question 15
A firm applies different marketing strategies to create value for the consumer which results in:
  • A.Customer Equity
  • B.Share of market
  • C.Share of customer
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

The first four steps in the marketing process involve building customer relationships by creating and delivering superior customer value. The final step involves capturing value in return in the form of current and future sales, market share, and profits. The outcomes of creating customer value: customer loyalty and retention, share of market and share of customer, and customer equity.

 

Share of customer- The portion of the customer’s purchasing that a company gets in its product categories.

 

Customer equity is the total combined customer lifetime values of all of the company’s current and potential customers. As such, it’s a measure of the future value of the company’s customer base.

 

Customer lifetime value- The value of the entire stream of purchases that the customer would make over a lifetime of patronage.

 

Market share represents the percentage of an industry, or a market's total sales, that is earned by a company over a specified time period.

Question 16
Match the following.List – II. Mega MarketingII. Penetration PriceIII. Promotion MixIV. Customer SatisfactionList – II1. Advertising2. Kotler3. Low price4. Post Purchase BehaviourCodes
  • A.1-I 2-II 3-III 4-IV
  • B.1-III 2-I 3-II 4-IV
  • C.1-IV 2-III 3-II 4-I
  • D.1-III 2-IV 3-I 4-II
Correct Answer: 1-III 2-I 3-II 4-IV

Mega Marketing is defined as the strategic coordination of economic, psychological, political and public relations skill to gain the co-operation of a number of parties in order to enter the Indian marketing. This approach is adopted by those large companies who are trying to enter blocked markets. The term Mega marketing was termed by Philip Kotler.

 

Penetration pricing is a pricing strategy where the price of a product is initially set low to rapidly reach a wide fraction of the market and initiate word of mouth. The strategy works on the expectation that customers will switch to the new brand because of the lower price.

 

 The Promotion Mix refers to the blend of several promotional tools used by the business to create, maintain and increase the demand for goods and services. The Promotion Mix is the integration of Advertising, Personal Selling, Sales Promotion, Public Relations and Direct Marketing. The marketers need to view the following questions in order to have a balanced blend of these promotional tools.

 

Customer satisfaction is a 'person's feeling of pleasure or disappointment which resulted from comparing a product's perceived performance or outcome against his/her expectations. Customer satisfaction leads to post purchase behaviour of any individual who buys the product and decides his future purchase as well.

Question 17
Identify correct statement.Statement I:In economies marked by goods shortages where consumers are not fussy about quality, features, or style business processes places marketing at the beginning of planning.Statement II:Instead of emphasizing making and selling, companies now see themselves as part of a value delivery process.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct

This question addresses the evolving role of marketing in business processes, especially in different economic contexts.

 

Statement I is incorrect. In economies marked by goods shortages where consumers are not particularly concerned about quality, features, or style, the traditional view might place marketing later in the planning process. These economies may prioritize production and selling, assuming that consumer demand is not highly specific.

 

Statement II is correct. In contrast, modern business practices, especially in economies with diverse consumer preferences, emphasize the importance of marketing. Companies now view themselves as part of a value delivery process, recognizing that marketing should play a central role from the beginning of planning. This approach involves understanding customer needs, preferences, and market segments and then designing and delivering offerings that align with these factors.

 

Therefore, the correct answer is (D) Statement I is incorrect, and Statement II is correct.

Question 18
The portion of the customer’s purchasing that a company gets in its product categories is called
  • A.Money of Customer
  • B.Stake of Customer
  • C.Value of Customer
  • D.Share of Customer
Correct Answer: Share of Customer

Share of Customer: The portion of the customer’s purchasing that a company gets in its product categories is called Share of Customer.

 

Beyond simply retaining good customers to capture customer lifetime value, good customer relationship management can also help marketers increase their share of customer. To increase this, firms can offer greater variety to current customers or they can create programs to cross-sell and up-sell in order to market more products and services to existing customers.

Question 19
Which of the following is not one of the 3 value disciplines for delivering superior customer value?
  • A.Operational excellence
  • B.Customer intimacy
  • C.Market leadership
  • D.Product leadership
Correct Answer: Market leadership

Following are the 3 value disciplines for delivering superior customer value:

1. Operational Excellence: The company provides superior value by leading its industry in price and convenience. It works to reduce costs and create a lean and efficient value delivery system. Examples include Walmart, Costco, and Southwest Airlines.

 

2. Customer Intimacy: The company provides superior value by precisely segmenting its markets and tailoring its products or services to exactly match the needs of targeted customers. It specializes in satisfying unique customer needs through a close relationship with and intimate knowledge of the customer. Examples include Nordstrom, Lexus, British Airways, and Ritz-Carlton.

 

3. Product Leadership: The company provides superior value by offering a continuous stream of leading-edge products or services. It aims to make its own and competing products obsolete. Product leaders are open to new ideas, relentlessly pursue new solutions, and work to get new products to market quickly. Example Apple.

Question 20
Identify among the following the 3 phases of value creation and delivery sequence?(i) Choosing the value(ii) Creating the value(iii) Strengthening the value(iv) Communicating the value(v) Providing the valueCodes
  • A.(ii), (iii), (iv)
  • B.(i), (ii), (v)
  • C.(i), (iv), (v)
  • D.(ii), (iii), (v)
Correct Answer: (i), (iv), (v)

We can divide the value creation and delivery sequence into 3 Phases.

 

First, choosing the value represents the “homework” marketing must do before any product exists. Marketers must segment the market, select the appropriate target, and develop the offering’s value positioning. The formula “segmentation, targeting, positioning (STP)” is the essence of strategic marketing.

The second phase is providing the value. Marketing must determine specific product features, prices, and distribution. 

The task in the third phase is communicating the value by utilizing the sales force, Internet, advertising, and any other communication tools to announce and promote the product. 

 

The value delivery process begins before there is a product and continues through development and after launch. Each phase has cost implications.

Question 21
Which one of the following is a research method that is used to identify how an organization is perceived by consumers of an organization and their competitors?
  • A.Competitor Value Analysis
  • B.Customer Value Analysis
  • C.Customer Profitability Analysis
  • D.Customer Perceived Value
Correct Answer: Customer Value Analysis

The correct answer is (B) Customer Value Analysis. It refers to a research method that is used to identify how an organization is perceived by consumers of an organization and their competitors. The analysis is conducted to determine what benefits target customers value and how they rate the relative value of various competitors’ efforts.

 

Customer Profitability Analysis (CPA) refers to the analysis, which companies perform to check if it costs more to do business with certain clients because Some customer groups provide profit for a company, and these are the groups that marketers target with advertisements and fantastic deals. However, with other customer groups, the company may be far off better without them, even if it causes potential public relations strife.

 

Customer Perceived Value (CPV) is the evaluated value that a customer perceives to obtain by buying a product. It is the difference between the total obtained benefits according to the customer perception and the cost that he had to pay for that. Customer perceived value is seen in terms of satisfaction of needs a product or service can offer to a potential customer. The customer will buy the same product again only if he perceives to be getting some value out of the product.

 

Competitor Analysis or Competitor Value Analysis refers to identifying your competitors and evaluating their strategies to determine their strengths and weaknesses relative to those of your own product or service.

Question 22
A research technique used particularly in retailing (online and offline), in which consumers are recruited by researchers to act as anonymous buyers in order to evaluate customer satisfaction, service quality and customer’s own evaluation of their experiences, is known as: (UGC NET Commerce Nov 2017)
  • A.Consumer Jury
  • B.Projective Technique
  • C.Mystery Shopping
  • D.Semiotic Research
Correct Answer: Mystery Shopping

The research technique described, in which consumers are recruited to act as anonymous buyers to evaluate customer satisfaction, service quality, and their own experiences, is known as "Mystery Shopping." These mystery shoppers then evaluate various aspects of their customer experience, such as service quality, product knowledge, cleanliness, and overall satisfaction. Mystery Shopping helps companies assess the performance of their employees and services from a customer's perspective. Therefore, the correct answer is (C) Mystery Shopping.

 

Consumer Jury: It typically refers to a group of consumers who are brought together to evaluate and provide feedback on products, services, or advertising campaigns. This feedback is usually obtained through discussions and opinions rather than actual purchasing and evaluation.

 

Projective Technique: Projective Techniques are a set of research methods used to uncover hidden or subconscious thoughts, feelings, and preferences of consumers. These techniques are often used in psychological and marketing research to understand consumer attitudes and motivations. They are not directly related to evaluating customer satisfaction or service quality in the context of retailing.

 

Semiotic Research involves the study of signs, symbols, and their meanings in communication. It is often used in advertising and marketing to analyze how visual and textual elements convey messages and influence consumer perceptions. While it plays a role in marketing research, it is not specifically focused on evaluating customer satisfaction or service quality.

Question 23
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Marketing mix model is less effective at assessing how different marketing elements work in combination.Statement II:The integration of important metrics such as customer satisfaction, awareness, and brand equity into marketing-mix modelling is limited.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

Marketing-mix models are analytical tools used to understand the impact of various marketing activities and elements on a company's performance. However, there are limitations to their effectiveness.

 

Statement I is correct. Marketing mix models are less effective at assessing how different marketing elements work in combination. They excel at isolating and analyzing the effects of specific marketing activities but may struggle to capture the nuances of how these elements interact synergistically.

 

Statement II is also correct. The integration of important metrics such as customer satisfaction, awareness, and brand equity into marketing-mix modeling is often limited. These models primarily focus on quantifiable data like sales, pricing, and promotional spending, making it challenging to incorporate more qualitative metrics related to customer perceptions and brand strength.

 

So, the correct answer is (A) Statement I is correct, and Statement II is correct.

Question 24
A scale used to measure the probability of a buyer making a particular purchase is called
  • A.Buyer's Purchasing Scale
  • B.Buyer's Intention Scale
  • C.Purchase Probability Scale
  • D.Buyer's Probability Scale
Correct Answer: Purchase Probability Scale

Purchase Probability Scale is a scale used to measure the probability of a buyer making a particular purchase. It is majorly used in consumer durables such as appliances, research organizations conduct periodic surveys of consumer buying intentions, ask questions like Do you intend to buy an automobile within the next six months? and rated on Purchase Probability Scale.

 

Question 25
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Value Proposition depends on the company’s ability to manage its value delivery system.Statement II:Value Delivery System consists of the whole cluster of benefits the company promises to deliver; it is more than the core positioning of the offering.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect

The correct answer is (C) Statement I is correct, and Statement II is incorrect.

 

Statement I is correct. The Value Proposition is a promise made by a company to its customers about the benefits they will receive from its product or service. This promise is based on the company's ability to deliver value effectively. In other words, the company must be capable of managing its value delivery system to fulfill the promises made in the Value Proposition.

 

Statement II is incorrect. The Value Delivery System comprises the entire set of activities and experiences that customers encounter while obtaining and using a company's offering. It includes not only the core benefits but also the supplementary elements such as customer service, convenience, and overall experience. The Value Proposition, on the other hand, represents the core positioning and the primary benefits offered by the product or service.

Question 26
Match the followingList I (Customer Value Assessment)(a) Internal Engineering Assessment(b) Focus-Group Value Assessment(c) Conjoint Analysis(d) Compositional ApproachList II (Description)(i) Ask customers to rank their preferences for alternative market offerings or concepts(ii) Ask customers in a focus group what value they would put on potential market offerings.(iii) Company engineers use lab tests to estimate the product’s performance characteristics(iv) Ask customers to attach a monetary value to each of three alternative levels of a given attribute.Select the correct response:Codes
  • A.a-(i), b-(ii), c-(iii), d-(iv)
  • B.a-(ii), b-(iv), c-(i), d-(iii)
  • C.a-(iii), b-(ii), c-(i), d-(iv)
  • D.a-(ii), b-(i), c-(iii), d-(iv)
Correct Answer: a-(iii), b-(ii), c-(i), d-(iv)

The correct option is (C).

 

Internal Engineering Assessment (a): In this method, company engineers use laboratory tests and technical analysis to estimate the product's performance characteristics. They evaluate the product from an internal perspective, looking at its technical attributes and capabilities. This assessment is valuable for understanding the technical feasibility and limitations of a product.

 

Focus-Group Value Assessment (b): This approach involves gathering a group of potential customers (focus group) and asking them about the value they would place on various potential market offerings or product features. It seeks to understand customer preferences and perceptions of value from the customer's perspective. This method helps in identifying what customers find most valuable.

 

Conjoint Analysis (c): Conjoint analysis is a statistical technique used to assess customer preferences for different product attributes and features. Customers are presented with various product profiles with different combinations of attributes, and they rank or rate these profiles. The analysis helps in determining the relative importance of each attribute and how they collectively contribute to a product's perceived value.

 

Compositional Approach (d): In this method, customers are asked to assign a monetary value to different levels or variations of a specific attribute or feature. For example, they might be asked how much extra they would pay for a product with a higher quality feature compared to a lower quality one. This approach quantifies the value customers place on specific attribute levels.

Question 27
The extent to which customers believe a firm can design and deliver products and services that satisfy their needs and wants is known as
  • A.Corporate credibility
  • B.Customer credibility
  • C.Corporate reputation
  • D.Cooperative transaction
Correct Answer: Corporate credibility

The extent to which customers believe a firm can design and deliver products and services that satisfy their needs and wants is known as (A) Corporate credibility.

 

Corporate credibility refers to the perception or belief that customers have in a firm's ability to design and deliver products and services that meet their needs and expectations. It's about establishing trust and confidence in the company's capabilities to provide what it promises. When customers believe a company has credibility, they are more likely to have faith in the firm's ability to deliver on its offerings, resulting in stronger customer satisfaction and loyalty.

Question 28
Corporate credibility depends upon
  • A.Corporate expertise
  • B.Corporate trustworthiness
  • C.Corporate likability
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

Corporate credibility depends on several factors, including:

 

(A) Corporate expertise: A company's credibility is often enhanced when it is seen as knowledgeable and skilled in its industry or field. Demonstrating expertise through products, services, and industry-specific knowledge can contribute to corporate credibility.

 

(B) Corporate trustworthiness: Trust is a fundamental component of credibility. Companies that consistently deliver on their promises, maintain transparency, and act ethically are viewed as trustworthy by customers and stakeholders.

 

(C) Corporate likability: While not the primary factor, likability can also contribute to corporate credibility. Companies that are perceived as friendly, approachable, and relatable may have an advantage in building credibility with their customer base.

 

So, the correct answer is (D) All of the above. Corporate credibility depends on a combination of expertise, trustworthiness, and likability to establish and maintain a positive reputation and build trust with customers and stakeholders.

Question 29
A firm is more likely to be seen as trustworthy when it
  • A.provides employees incentives that are aligned to meet with customer needs
  • B.partners with customers to help them learn and help themselves
  • C.offers valid comparisons with competitive products
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

A firm is more likely to be seen as trustworthy when it incorporates several key practices, as outlined in the options:

 

(A) Provides employees incentives that are aligned to meet customer needs: When a company aligns employee incentives with customer needs, it demonstrates a commitment to prioritizing customer satisfaction. This alignment encourages employees to understand and address customer needs effectively, leading to enhanced trust in the firm.

 

(B) Partners with customers to help them learn and help themselves: Collaborating with customers and assisting them in understanding the product or service and how to use it optimally fosters trust. This partnership signifies the company's dedication to customer success and satisfaction.

 

(C) Offers valid comparisons with competitive products: Providing accurate and valid comparisons with competitive products demonstrates transparency and honesty. This helps customers make informed decisions, leading to a perception of trustworthiness in the firm.

 

So, the correct answer is (D) All of the above. A firm is more likely to be seen as trustworthy when it aligns employee incentives with customer needs, partners with customers to assist them, and offers valid comparisons with competitive products. These practices reflect a commitment to transparency, customer-centricity, and ethical conduct, which are key aspects of building trust with customers.

Question 30
Fill in the blanks:Statementsa. Loyal customers____ products.b. Loyal customers are____ sensitive.c. Loyal customers pay____ to competitor’s advertising.d. Serving existing customer is ____Alternatives1. less attention2. cheaper3. less price4. buy moreCodes
  • A.a-3, b-1. C-2, d-4
  • B.a-4, b-3, c-1, d-2
  • C.a-2, b-1, c-3, d-4
  • D.a-4, b-3, c-2, d-1
Correct Answer: a-4, b-3, c-1, d-2

Loyal customers buy more products- As they have faith in the company, they tend to buy more products without a second thought.

 

Loyal customers are less price sensitive- As they are fully satisfied with the services/ products they are getting; they hardly haggle on price.

 

Loyal customers pay less attention to competitor’s advertising- As loyal customers have a good brand image of brand in their eyes they pay less attention to competitor’s advertising and prefer to buy from the same company again.

 

Serving existing customer is cheaper- Because they are loyal and no need of advertisement and promotion is required in persuading them to buy the product.

Question 31
Who said "the only value your company will ever create is the value that comes from customers"?
  • A.Don Peppers
  • B.Martha Rogers
  • C.Seth Godin
  • D.Both A and B
Correct Answer: Both A and B

Creating loyal customers is at the heart of every business. As marketing experts Don Peppers and Martha Rogers say -

 

"The only value your company will ever create is the value that comes from customers— the ones you have now and the ones you will have in the future. Businesses succeed by getting, keeping, and growing customers. Customers are the only reason you build factories, hire employees, schedule meetings, lay fiber-optic lines, or engage in any business activity. Without customers, you don’t have a business."

Question 32
__________is the difference between the prospective customer’s evaluation of all the benefits and all the costs of an offering and the perceived alternatives.
  • A.Customer Prospectus Value
  • B.Customer Perceived Value
  • C.Customer Benefit Value
  • D.Customer Equity
Correct Answer: Customer Perceived Value

Customer-Perceived Value (CPV) is the difference between the prospective customer’s evaluation of all the benefits and all the costs of an offering and the perceived alternatives. It is based on the difference between benefits the customer gets and costs he or she assumes for different choices. The marketer can increase the value of the customer offering by raising economic, functional, or emotional benefits and/or reducing one or more costs. 

 

Total Customer Benefit is the perceived monetary value of the bundle of economic, functional, and psychological benefits customers expect from a given market offering because of the product, service, people, and image. 

 

Total Customer Cost is the perceived bundle of costs customers expect to incur in evaluating, obtaining, using, and disposing of the given market offering, including monetary, time, energy, and psychological costs.

Question 33
Arrange the steps of Customer Value Analysis in correct order.(i) Assess the company’s and competitors’ performances on the different customer values against their rated importance.(ii) Assess the quantitative importance of the different attributes and benefits.(iii) Monitor customer values over time.(iv) Identify the major attributes and benefits customers value.(v) Examine how customers in a specific segment rate the company’s performance against a specific major competitor.Choose the correct answer using the codes given below:Codes
  • A.(ii), (iv), (i), (iii), (v)
  • B.(ii), (iii), (iv), (i), (v)
  • C.(iii), (ii), (v), (i), (iv)
  • D.(i), (v), (iv), (ii), (iii)
Correct Answer: (iii), (ii), (v), (i), (iv)

Customer Value Analysis is the report of the company’s strengths and weaknesses relative to various competitors.

The steps in this Analysis are:

 

(i) Identify the major attributes and benefits customers value: Customers are asked what attributes, benefits, and performance levels they look for in choosing a product and vendors. Attributes and benefits should be defined broadly to encompass all the inputs to customers’ decisions.

 

(ii) Assess the quantitative importance of the different attributes and benefits: Customers are asked to rate the importance of different attributes and benefits. If their ratings diverge too much, the marketer should cluster them into different segments.

 

(iii) Assess the company’s and competitors’ performances on the different customer values against their rated importance: Customers describe where they see the company’s and competitors’ performances on each attribute and benefit.

 

(iv) Examine how customers in a specific segment rate the company’s performance against a specific major competitor on an individual attribute or benefit basis: If the company’s offer exceeds the competitor’s offer on all important attributes and benefits, the company can charge a higher price (thereby earning higher profits), or it can charge the same price and gain more market share.

 

(v) Monitor customer values over time: The company must periodically re-do its studies of customer values and competitors’ standings as the economy, technology, and features change.

Question 34
Who define loyalty as “a deeply held commitment to rebuy or re-patronize a preferred product or service in the future despite situational influences and marketing efforts having the potential to cause switching behavior?”
  • A.Richard L Oliver
  • B.Peter Drucker
  • C.Jack Trout
  • D.Adam Smith
Correct Answer: Richard L Oliver

Richard L Oliver defines loyalty as “a deeply held commitment to rebuy or re-patronize a preferred product or service in the future despite situational influences and marketing efforts having the potential to cause switching behavior.”

Question 35
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Increasing Customer Satisfaction by lowering price or increasing services is the right way to create customer loyalty.Statement II:Satisfaction is a person’s feelings of pleasure or disappointment that result from comparing a product’s perceived performance (or outcome) to expectations.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct

The correct answer is (D) Statement I is incorrect, and Statement II is correct.

 

Statement I is incorrect. While increasing customer satisfaction is important, it's not always achieved by lowering prices or increasing services. Customer loyalty is often built on a combination of factors, including the quality of the product or service, the overall customer experience, brand trust, and more. Simply lowering prices may not necessarily result in increased customer loyalty, and it could even lead to lower profits.

 

Statement II is correct. Satisfaction is indeed a person's emotional response based on how a product or service performs in comparison to their expectations. If the product or service meets or exceeds expectations, customers tend to be satisfied. However, satisfaction alone may not guarantee customer loyalty, as loyalty can be influenced by various other factors.

Question 36
Which among the following are the techniques to monitor customer satisfaction?
  • A.Periodic Surveys
  • B.Customer loss rate
  • C.Mystery shoppers
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

Wise firms measure customer satisfaction regularly, because it is one key to customer retention. They systematically measuring how well they treat customers, identifying the factors shaping satisfaction, and changing operations and marketing as a result.

Some of the techniques are mentioned below:

 

(i) Periodic surveys can track customer satisfaction directly and ask additional questions to measure repurchase intention and the respondent’s likelihood or willingness to recommend the company and brand to others.

 

(ii) Customer Loss Rate: Companies need to monitor their competitors’ performance too. They can monitor their customer loss rate and contact those who have stopped buying or who have switched to another supplier to find out why.

 

(iii) Mystery Shoppers: Finally, companies can hire mystery shoppers to pose as potential buyers and report on strong and weak points experienced in buying the company’s and competitors’ products. Managers themselves can enter company and competitor sales situations where they are unknown and experience first-hand the treatment they receive, or they can phone their own company with questions and complaints to see how employees handle the calls.

Question 37
Who said "customer’s willingness to recommend results from how well the customer is treated by frontline employees, which in turn is determined by all the functional areas that contribute to a customer’s experience?"
  • A.Adam Smith
  • B.Richard L Oliver
  • C.Frederick Reichheld
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Frederick Reichheld

According to Fredrick Reichheld, "a customer’s willingness to recommend results from how well the customer is treated by frontline employees, which in turn is determined by all the functional areas that contribute to a customer’s experience." He suggests only one customer question really matters: “How likely is it that you would recommend this product or service to a friend or colleague?”

 

In a typical Net Promoter Survey which was followed after Reichheld’s thinking, customers are asked to rate their likelihood to recommend on a 0 to 10-point scale. Marketers then subtract detractors (those who gave a 0 to 6) from promoters (those who gave a 9 or 10) to arrive at the Net Promoter Score (NPS). Customers who rate the brand with a 7 or 8 are deemed passively satisfied and are not included. A typical set of NPS scores falls in the 10 percent to 30 percent range, but world-class companies scored over 50 percent.

Question 38
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Its always the company’s largest customers, who can demand considerable service and deep discounts, yield the most profit.Statement II:There is a high correlation between relative product quality and company profitability.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct

The correct answer is (D) Statement I is incorrect, and Statement II is correct.

 

Statement I is incorrect. While large customers can be important to a company, it's not always the case that they yield the most profit. Profitability depends on various factors, including the pricing strategy, cost of serving these customers, and the overall value they bring to the company. Sometimes, serving large customers with considerable demands and deep discounts may lead to lower profit margins.

 

Statement II is correct. There is indeed a high correlation between the relative quality of a product or service and a company's profitability. Higher product or service quality often leads to increased customer satisfaction, which can, in turn, support higher prices, reduced costs (due to fewer quality-related issues), and, ultimately, higher profitability.

Question 39
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Activity Based Costing tries to identify the real costs associated with serving each customer i.e., the costs of products and services based on the resources they consume.Statement II:Account Based Costing include the cost of making and distributing the products and services and do not include any other company's resources that go into serving that customer.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect

The correct answer is (C) Statement I is correct, and Statement II is incorrect.

 

Statement I is correct. Activity-Based Costing (ABC) is an accounting technique that aims to identify the actual costs associated with serving each customer. It allocates costs to products and services based on the specific resources they consume, providing a more accurate picture of cost distribution.

 

Statement II is incorrect. The description of Account-Based Costing (ABC) in Statement II does not align with the conventional understanding of ABC. Account-Based Costing primarily focuses on the allocation of costs to specific customer accounts or clients based on their unique activities and resource consumption. It considers all costs associated with serving a customer, not just the costs of making and distributing products and services.

Question 40
__________describes the net present value of the stream of future profits expected over the customer’s lifetime purchases.
  • A.Customer Lifetime Value
  • B.Customer Lifetime Satisfaction
  • C.Customer Lifetime Profitability
  • D.None of the Above
Correct Answer: Customer Lifetime Value

Customer Lifetime Value: The case for maximizing long-term customer profitability is captured in the concept of customer lifetime value. Customer lifetime value (CLV) describes the net present value of the stream of future profits expected over the customer’s lifetime purchases. The company must subtract from its expected revenues the expected costs of attracting, selling, and servicing the account of that customer, applying the appropriate discount rate.

Marketers who use CLV concepts must also take into account the short-term, brand-building marketing activities that help increase customer loyalty.

Question 41
Researchers and practitioners have used many different approaches for modeling and estimating CLV. Formula to estimate the CLV for a not-yet acquired customer as given by Don Lehman and Sunil Gupta is
  • A.CLV=∑t=0Tpt-ctrt(1+i)t
  • B.(B) CLV=∑t=0Tpt-ctrt(1-i)t-AC
  • C.(C) CLV=∑t=0Tpt-ctrt(1+i)t-AC
  • D.(D) None of above
Correct Answer: (C) CLV=∑t=0Tpt-ctrt(1+i)t-AC

Columbia’s Don Lehmann and Harvard’s Sunil Gupta recommend the following formula to estimate the CLV for a not-yet acquired customer.

CLV= ∑t=0Tpt-ctrt(1+i)t-AC

where pt = price paid by a consumer at time t,

ct = direct cost of servicing the customer at time t,

i = discount rate or cost of capital for the firm,

rt = probability of customer repeat buying or being “alive” at time t,

AC = acquisition cost,

T = time horizon for estimating CLV.

A key decision is what time horizon to use for estimating CLV. Typically, 3 to 5 years is reasonable.

Question 42
Statement I:A satisfied consumer is more likely to purchase the product again and will also tend to say good things about the brand to others.Statement II:Marketers should also monitor how buyers use and dispose of the product.Select the correct option:
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

The correct answer is (A) Statement I is correct, and Statement II is correct.

 

Statement I is correct. A satisfied consumer is more likely to exhibit positive behaviors such as repurchasing the product and advocating for the brand by saying good things about it to others. This reflects the positive impact of customer satisfaction on brand loyalty and word-of-mouth marketing.

 

Statement II is correct. Marketers should indeed monitor how buyers use and dispose of their products. Understanding post-purchase behavior, including product usage patterns and disposal methods, can provide valuable insights for product improvement, marketing strategy refinement, and identifying opportunities for upselling or cross-selling related products.

Question 43
Match the following.List I(a) Value Proposition(b) Value Exploration(c) Value Creation(d) Value DeliveryList II(i) New value offerings.(ii) Set of benefits to satisfy customer needs.(iii) Delivering new value offerings.(iv) Identifying new opportunities.Codes
  • A.a-(iv) b-(iii) c-(ii) d-(i)
  • B.a-(ii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(iii)
  • C.a-(i) b-(iv) c-(iii) d-(ii)
  • D.a-(iii) b-(iv) c-(ii) d-(i)
Correct Answer: a-(ii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(iii)

The correct match is (B) a-(ii) b-(iv) c-(i) d-(iii).

 

(a) Value Proposition - This is about presenting the set of benefits or value that a product or service offers to satisfy customer needs. So, it matches with (ii) Set of benefits to satisfy customer needs.

 

(b) Value Exploration - This is related to identifying new opportunities for creating value. So, it matches with (iv) Identifying new opportunities.

 

(c) Value Creation - This involves creating new value offerings, which matches with (i) New value offerings.

 

(d) Value Delivery - This is about delivering the new value offerings to customers. So, it matches with (iii) Delivering new value offerings.

Question 44
What is customer value?
  • A.Ratio between the customer’s perceived benefits and the resources used to obtain these benefits.
  • B.Excess of satisfaction over expectation.
  • C.Post purchase dissonance
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Ratio between the customer’s perceived benefits and the resources used to obtain these benefits.

Customer value refers to the relationship between the perceived benefits a customer receives from a product or service and the resources (such as time, money, effort) they invest to obtain these benefits. It's essentially the ratio between what the customer perceives as the benefits gained and what they had to invest to acquire those benefits. This definition aligns with option A.

Question 45
Who do buy more, complain less, spread positive word of mouth, ensure a large customer base and repeat business?
  • A.Satisfied customers
  • B.Delighted customers
  • C.Industrial customers
  • D.None of the above
Correct Answer: Delighted customers

The correct answer is (B) Delighted customers.

 

Delighted customers are highly satisfied customers who not only make repeat purchases but also advocate for the product or service, spreading positive word of mouth. They are more likely to refer others to the business and help in expanding the customer base. Additionally, delighted customers are less likely to complain because their experience has surpassed their expectations, resulting in a strong and loyal customer base.

Question 46
Assertion:High customer expectations lead to dissatisfaction as product performance never matches them.Reason:Product performance is always customer specific.Codes:
  • A.Both A and R are correct.
  • B.Both A and R are incorrect.
  • C.A is correct, but R is incorrect.
  • D.R is correct, but A is incorrect.
Correct Answer: Both A and R are incorrect.

High customer expectations lead to dissatisfaction as product performance never matches them is a wrong statement as producers tries his best to match the needs of customer and often succeeds in providing the required product successfully.

Product performance is not always customer specific, the product performs as per the usage and may result in different ways according to the customer or maybe not.

Question 47
What is customer delight?
  • A.Performance equal to expectation
  • B.Performance less than expectation
  • C.Performance more than expectation
  • D.Expectation more than performance
Correct Answer: Performance more than expectation

The correct answer is (C) Performance more than expectation.

 

Customer delight occurs when the actual performance or experience with a product or service exceeds the customer's expectations. It goes beyond meeting expectations and provides an exceptional and positive surprise to the customer. When a product or service not only fulfills the customer's needs but also surpasses what they anticipated, it creates a sense of delight and satisfaction, contributing to a positive perception of the brand and encouraging repeat business and customer loyalty.

Question 48
The difference between the prospective consumer’s evaluation of all the benefits and costs of an offering and perceived alternatives, is known as (UGC NET Commerce Aug 2016)
  • A.Customer perceived value
  • B.Total customer value
  • C.Total customer cost
  • D.Customer expected value
Correct Answer: Customer perceived value

Customer Perceived Value (CPV) is the difference between the prospective customer’s evaluation of all the benefits and all the costs of an offering and the perceived alternatives.

 

Total customer value is the perceived monetary value of the bundle of economic, functional, and psychological benefits customers expect from a given market offering. Sources include product value, services value, personnel value, and image value.

 

Total customer cost is the bundle of costs customers expect to incur in evaluating, obtaining, using, and disposing of the given market offering. Sources include monetary cost, time cost, energy cost, and psychological cost.

Question 49
Which of the following are consumption values that customers look for in any product or service in a society?1. Functional value2. Social value3. Money value4. Emotional value5. Maximum valueCodes:
  • A.1, 2, 3, 5
  • B.1, 3, 4, 5
  • C.5, 4, 3, 2, 1
  • D.1, 2 and 4
Correct Answer: 1, 2 and 4

Value in marketing, also known as customer-perceived value, is the difference between a prospective customer's evaluation of the benefits and costs of one product when compared with others. Value may also be expressed as a straightforward relationship between perceived benefits and perceived costs.

Value = Benefits / Cost.

 

The four types of value include: functional value, monetary value, social value, and psychological value. The sources of value are not equally important to all consumers. How important a value is, depends on the consumer and the purchase. Values should always be defined through the "eyes" of the consumer.

Functional Value: This type of value is what an offer does, it's the solution an offer provides to the customer.

Monetary Value: This is where the function of the price paid is relative to an offerings perceived worth. This value invites a trade-off between other values and monetary costs.

Social Value: The extent to which owning a product or engaging in a service allows the consumer to connect with others.

Psychological Value: The extent to which a product allows consumers to express themselves or feel better.

Question 50
Which one of the following is the report of the company’s strengths and weaknesses relative to various competitors?
  • A.Competitor Value Analysis
  • B.Customer Value Analysis
  • C.Customer Profitability Analysis
  • D.Customer Perceived Value
Correct Answer: Customer Value Analysis

The correct answer is (A) Competitor Value Analysis.

 

Competitor Value Analysis is a report that assesses a company's strengths and weaknesses relative to various competitors in the market. It involves evaluating how a company's products or services compare to those of its competitors in terms of value delivered to customers. This analysis helps a company understand its competitive position and identify areas where it can improve to gain a competitive advantage.

 

Customer Value Analysis, on the other hand, focuses on understanding the value that customers perceive in a company's offerings and how they compare them to alternatives. Customer Profitability Analysis examines the profitability of individual customers or customer segments. Customer Perceived Value is related to how customers perceive the value of a company's products or services.

Question 51
The whole cluster of benefits the company promises to deliver is
  • A.Branding
  • B.Value Proposition
  • C.Marketing
  • D.Customization
Correct Answer: Value Proposition

The correct answer is (B) Value Proposition.

 

The whole cluster of benefits that a company promises to deliver to customers is known as the "Value Proposition." It represents the unique combination of features, benefits, and advantages that a company's product or service offers to its customers. A strong value proposition is a key element of a company's marketing strategy, as it communicates to customers ‘why’ they should choose a particular product or service over competitors' offerings.

Question 52
Which among the followings are customer value triad?(i) relations(ii) service(iii) price(iv) innovation(v) qualityCodes
  • A.(i), (ii), (iii)
  • B.(ii), (iii), (v)
  • C.(ii), (iv), (v)
  • D.(i), (iii), (iv)
Correct Answer: (ii), (iii), (v)

The correct answer is (B) (ii), (iii), (v).

 

Customer value triad refers to the three fundamental elements that contribute to the perceived value of a product or service from the customer's perspective. In this case, the triad includes:

 

(ii) Service: The quality and level of service provided to the customer, including customer support, assistance, and after-sales services.

 

(iii) Price: The cost of the product or service, which plays a significant role in determining the value for the customer.

 

(v) Quality: The overall quality of the product or service, meeting or exceeding customer expectations and needs.

Question 53
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Satisfaction reflects a person’s judgment of a product’s perceived performance in relationship to expectation.Statement II:If performance matches expectations, the customer is delighted.Codes
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect

The correct answer is (C) Statement I is correct, and Statement II is incorrect.

 

Statement I is correct. Satisfaction is indeed a measure of how a person judges a product's performance in relation to their expectations. Customers form opinions about products based on how well they meet or exceed their anticipated performance.

 

Statement II is incorrect. If a product's performance matches customers' expectations, they are typically satisfied, not necessarily delighted. Delight typically occurs when the product exceeds expectations and provides an exceptional experience.

Question 54
“Firms nowadays estimating individual customer lifetime value and design their market offerings and prices to make a profit over the customer’s lifetime.” This activity is an example of
  • A.Customer centricity
  • B.Customer value
  • C.Positioning
  • D.Firm's CSR activity
Correct Answer: Customer centricity

Customer-centricity is a way of doing business that fosters a positive customer experience at every stage of the customer journey. It’s a strategy that’s based on putting your customer first, and at the core of your business.

 

Companies are shaping separate offers, services, and messages to individual customers, based on information about past transactions, demographics, psychographics, and media and distribution preferences. By focusing on their most profitable customers, products, and channels, these firms hope to achieve profitable growth by developing customer loyalty. They estimate individual customer lifetime value and design their market offerings and prices to make a profit over the customer’s lifetime. These activities fall under what Columbia Business School professor Larry Selden and his wife and business consulting partner, Yoko Sugiura Selden, call “customer centricity.”

 

Customer Lifetime Value: The value of the entire stream of purchases a customer makes over a lifetime of patronage.

Question 55
The task of any business is to deliver
  • A.Fuel to the economy
  • B.Customer Value
  • C.Enrichment to the Society
  • D.Educational Value
Correct Answer: Customer Value

The fundamental goal of any business is to deliver value to its customers while maintaining profitability. In a highly competitive economy where consumers are well-informed and presented with a plethora of options, a business can succeed by optimizing the process of delivering superior value and effectively communicating this value to its target audience. Customer value lies at the heart of a successful business model, fostering customer satisfaction, loyalty, and positive long-term relationships.

Question 56
Customer's evaluation of the difference between the prospective customer’s evaluation of all the benefits and all the costs of a marketing offer relative to those of competing offers is called
  • A.Customer Perceived Value
  • B.Customer Differentiated Value
  • C.Customer Unique Value
  • D.Customer Demand Value
Correct Answer: Customer Perceived Value

Customer Perceived Value (CPV) is the customer's evaluation of the difference between the prospective customer’s evaluation of all the benefits and all the costs of a marketing offer relative to those of competing offers. A customer buys from the firm that offers the highest customer perceived value. Importantly, customers often do not judge values and costs "accurately" or "objectively". They act on perceived value.

Question 57
The value of the entire stream of purchases a customer makes over a lifetime of patronage is called
  • A.Customer Lifetime Value
  • B.Customer Purchase Value
  • C.Customer Relation Value
  • D.Customer Generated Value
Correct Answer: Customer Lifetime Value

Customer Lifetime Value: The value of the entire stream of purchases a customer makes over a lifetime of patronage.

Keeping loyal customers makes sense because they spend more, stay around longer, and research also shows that it is five times cheaper to keep an old customer than acquire a new one. Conversely, customer defections can be costly. Losing a customer means losing more than a single sale, it means losing customer lifetime value. The loss can also be much greater if the disappointed customer shares the bad experience with other customers and causes them to defect.

Question 58
Customer lifetime value is affected by which of the following costs?
  • A.Customer Acquisition
  • B.Customer Retention
  • C.Add-on selling
  • D.All of the above
Correct Answer: All of the above

The sum of lifetime values of all customers is known as Customer Equity.

 

Customer lifetime value is affected by revenue and by the costs of:

(a) Customer Acquisition: Depends on the number of prospects, the acquisition probability of a prospect, and acquisition spending per prospect

(b) Customer Retention: It is influenced by the retention rate and retention spending level

(c) Add-on Spending: is a function of the efficiency of add-on selling, the number of add-on selling offers given to existing customers, and the response rate to new offers.

Question 59
The total combined customer lifetime values of all of the company’s customers, is called:
  • A.Customer equity
  • B.Share of customer
  • C.Customer lifetime value
  • D.Customer financial return
Correct Answer: Customer equity

Customer Equity is the total of discounted lifetime values of all of the firms’ customers. In layman terms, the more loyal a customer, the more is the customer equity. Customer equity is a result of customer relationship management.

 

Share of customer is the portion of the customer’s purchasing that a company gets in its product categories.

 

Customer lifetime value (CLV) refers to the present value of the profit stream that the company would have realized if the customer had not defected prematurely. To measure CLV: Subtract the expected costs of attracting, selling, and servicing that customer from the expected revenues.

 

 To analyze profitability, you can use: Customer Profitability Analysis (CPA), which can be best done through Activity Based Costing (ABC). To increase company profitability, companies should build sustainable competitive advantage or leverageable competitive advantages. The key to value creation and customer satisfaction is total product and service quality; companies that wish to remain solvent and profitable implement.

Question 60
Given below are two statements, one labelled as Assertion “A” and the other labelled as Reason “R”. Read the statements and choose the correct answer using the code given below.Assertion “A”:The marketing costs of reaching loyal consumers are much lower because the firm does not have to spend money on advertising and promotion campaigns to attract these customers.Reason “R”:A high level of brand loyalty does not insulate the firm from competition.Codes
  • A.Both A and R are correct and R is the right explanation of A
  • B.Both A and R are incorrect.
  • C.Both A and R are correct, but R is not the right explanation of A
  • D.A is correct, but R is incorrect
Correct Answer: Both A and R are correct, but R is not the right explanation of A

The marketing costs of reaching loyal consumers are much lower because the firm does not have to spend money on advertising and promotion campaigns to attract these customers, because these customers are loyal and will try to purchase from the same firm without a second thought.

 

A high level of brand loyalty does not insulate the firm from competition because competitors are emerging day by day with new techniques and strategies which may be better from the existing firm. So, brand loyalty is not always assured.

Question 61
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Identifying your touchpoints is the first step toward creating a customer journey map.Statement II:To improve customer satisfaction, you need to make sure each touchpoint leads to a good customer experience.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

A touchpoint is any time a potential customer or customer comes in contact with a particular brand–before, during, or after they purchase something from it. Identifying your touchpoints is the first step toward creating a customer journey map. To improve customer satisfaction, you need to make sure each touchpoint leads to a good customer experience, and that the journey as a whole deliver on customers’ expectations.

Therefore, both statements are correct.

Question 62
Identify correct statement.Statement I:Although it’s necessary to be customer oriented, it’s not enough.Statement II:The organization must also be creative to deliver customer value.
  • A.Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct
  • B.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is incorrect
  • C.Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect
  • D.Statement I is incorrect and Statement II is correct
Correct Answer: Statement I is correct and Statement II is correct

Although it’s necessary to be customer oriented, it’s not enough. The organization must also be creative to deliver customer value. Companies today copy each other’s advantages and strategies with increasing speed, making differentiation harder to achieve and lowering margins as firms become more alike. The only answer is to build a capability in strategic innovation and imagination. This capability comes from assembling tools, processes, skills, and measures that let the firm generate more and better new ideas than its competitors

 

Transforming into a true customer-driven company requires:

(i) Developing a company-wide passion for customers.

(ii) Organizing around customer segments instead of products.

(iii) Understanding customers through qualitative and quantitative researches.

 

The task is not easy, but the payoffs can be considerable. It won’t happen as a result of the CEO making speeches and urging every employee to “think customer.” It requires some concrete actions from CEO some of which are given below:

(i) Convince senior management of the need to become customer focused.

(ii) Appoint a senior marketing officer and marketing task force

(iii)Get outside help and guidance. Consulting firms have considerable experience helping companies adopt a marketing orientation.

(iv) Change the company’s reward measurement and system.

(v) Hire strong marketing talent.

(vi) Develop strong in-house marketing training programs.

(vii)Install a modern marketing planning system.

(viii) Establish an annual marketing excellence recognition program.

(ix) Shift from a department focus to a process-outcome focus.

(x) Empower the employees.

Question 63
